test_delay_reaping_conf_bad_value (test.unit.account.test_reaper.TestReaper) ... ok
test_delay_reaping_conf_default (test.unit.account.test_reaper.TestReaper) ... ok
test_delay_reaping_conf_set (test.unit.account.test_reaper.TestReaper) ... ok
test_reap_delay (test.unit.account.test_reaper.TestReaper) ... ok
test_placeholder (test.unit.account.test_replicator.TestReplicator) ... ok
test_DELETE_empty (test.unit.account.test_server.TestAccountController) ... ok
test_DELETE_not_empty (test.unit.account.test_server.TestAccountController) ... ok

instead of (which is what I get for current master):

cthier@swift1:~/swift$ ./.unittests 
...................................."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-11-29 13:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Allow dot test runners from any dir

Currently the .*test files in the source tree root seem to assume you're
in that directory when you run them.  This change should work exactly
the same except for removing that restriction.

Change-Id: I9b037016490dd6d5b515cb2c3cad2f99ee40bb6d

Removed unused imports founded by:

find . -type f -name "*py" -exec pylint -r n {} \; | grep -E "Unused imp|^\*"

commit_message:
Removes unused imports

Removed unused imports founded by:

find . -type f -name "*py" -exec pylint -r n {} \; | grep -E "Unused imp|^\*"

Change-Id: I84f81ed833f6f792c5beb41a4d6b26cbb3236b2b

commit_message:
Fixes bug 1086290
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1086290,
edit-flavor broken when flavor has extra specs.
Includes unittest for the same, and modified mock data to
to include extra-specs
Change-Id: I286d97568daff26bbd03418b2ea0b808caceadba

commit_message:
Catch ProcessExecutionError when building config drives.

There's not a lot we can do here, the instance is invalid. However,
the better log message will hopefully make this easier for operators
to diagnose.

Partially addresses bug 872489.

Change-Id: Ib650cb114e57956bfe911370dd52aa4fdd4adc78

Just for other's reference - when we discussed this briefly at last week's Nova meeting two things came up

Firstly, this approach will only allow getting coverage for the API server unless you use nova-all

Secondly, something like eventlet_backdoor might be a more suitable interface for switching on converage

Also, thinking about it a bit more, we probably also want a way to switch coverage at startup too - i.e. a bunch of code only gets run at startup time, so you'll often want to include that in the coverage report"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-04 22:03:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add coverage extension to nova API.

This adds a new extension to nova API. It allows for internal use of
Ned Batchelder's coverage_ module. (what is used for the nosecoverage
plugin)

The api allows for coverage to be enabled and a report to be output to
a file with API calls. The intended use of this is for instrumenting
client based tests like Tempest. Coverage on tempest will not give
information regarding how much of nova is covered.

Implements: blueprint coverage-extension
Change-Id: I47497f5be3fd5956250f2dcd1630c86c72725ce8
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Revert "Simplify how ephemeral disks are created and named."

This needs another attempt. Associated with bug 1087028.

commit_message:
Moves the mgmt tests to their own group.

Now running the blackbox group won't invoke the mgmt API, which can be
run as part of the "blackbox_mgmt" group.
This partially implements the blueprint "fix-tests." Please note, it's
only partial! It doesn't fix all of the tests.

blueprint fix-tests
Change-Id: Ic5806369f9a6fac47f4517091617c02ea33f5d00

[{'created': '2012-12-11 19:24:53.000000000', 'message': "Get rid of glanceclient dependency

We're not actually using it anywhere, and its keystoneclient version
requirements are causing us not to be able to install. Move it instead to
the test-requires, since the functional tests are still actually using it.

Change-Id: I74e68ddb4b65235b6c192c619e9e8e85e30beab9
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of glanceclient dependency

We're not actually using it anywhere, and its keystoneclient version
requirements are causing us not to be able to install. Move it instead to
the test-requires, since the functional tests are still actually using it.

Change-Id: I74e68ddb4b65235b6c192c619e9e8e85e30beab9
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adds --os-cache to replace old --no-cache.

Deprecates the old --no-cache option in favor of --os-cache.

The old CLI args (--no_cache and --no-cache) and ENV option
(OS_NO_CACHE) are still supported but no longer show up
in help.

The new option for --os-cache can also be set via the OS_CACHE ENV
variable... which now defaults to False. This should be much more user friendly.

Fixes LP Bug #1087776.

Change-Id: I3cea089c7e11ce75f22c2d7f3242b02b80441323

commit_message:
heat engine : convert WaitConditionHandle URL to ARN format

Convert the WaitConditionHandle URL format to use the ARN format,
the resulting URL will be similar to the AWS format

fixes bug 1087799

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I04b1f6cd913c54c9f4fa82cc1e76be22a19fe2ea

Looks like the  handling 'deleted' is a bit confusing.
There is the 'deleted' attribute on the table, and the records excluded by cinder filtered by this. Probably when it set to true, the deleted_at attribute also got a value.
 
The 'deleted' status not excluded in most cases, just the records has the deleted=true."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-11-28 09:01:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am confused. What do you want the two deleted states mapped to?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-06 01:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

'deleting' --> 'pending' - MUST
'deleted'  I accept both 'pending' and exclude.

DB records has a logical delete flag.
In cinder case it sets this flag at the same time as the status.
The snapshot listing as I remember not listing logically deleted ones.

In the in-line comment I described Why the 'pending' is the expected for deleting, and generally what is my expectations for ec2 snapshot status.

I did not checked what does the cinder shows as status when snapshot is used for volume creation. And what its reaction when I try a concurrent delete. Now it is out of scope."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-06 01:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Map cinder snapshot statuses to ec2.

EC2 has way fewer statuses than cinder does, so we need to map them
to valid entries. Resolves bug 1080284.

DocImpact.

Change-Id: I73bb2905577fb6f727c0a805df2654ad1bb4ad72

commit_message:
Adds support for security group/rules quotas.

Updates novaclient's quota and quota_class handlers to support
the security_groups and security_group_rules quotas that are now in
Nova.

Fixes LP Bug #1084682.

Change-Id: I04d90681d535124d7d497e06e8c1ea4f2cb8f4f4

commit_message:
Modified sample tests to FlavorExtraData API.

Added subs wherever applicable.
Added checks for correct return codes after REST ops
Modified sample tests to FlavorManage API to differentiate them
from the ones in FlavorExtraData.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-samples
Fixes bug 1070162

Change-Id: I57c6611f379bef2ff586551b5501c4f7654e4374

commit_message:
Consider reserved count in os-user-limits extension

Fixes bug 1088606

Previously, the reserved count was not considered in the
total<Resource>Used values returned, leading to a potentially
inaccurate view of the actual headroom available when resource
creation was in-flight.

Now, the reserved count is optionally included, controlled
by a new 'reserved' query parameter.

Change-Id: If71ac6f8e428b58b7c80c67ad99124e4233102d1

commit_message:
Add get_backdoor_port to nova-conductor.

This adds a get_backdoor_port function to nova conductor
which enables returning the eventlet_backdoor port from
rpc for the service.

Change-Id: Ifb08c685a6f52621e954ba84e3c5eadf83fe4704

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-05 23:14:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix handling of unimplemented host actions

Fixes bug #1060884

Host actions like enable/disable, maintenance mode and power management
are not implemented in most virt drivers.

In the case of set_host_enabled() in the libvirt driver, we have a no-op
implementation. In other cases we have an implementation which raises
NotImplementedError. Since the default implementation is to do this, we
should just remove the redundant methods from the drivers which don't
actually implement these actions. This ensures NotImplementedError is
consistently raised.

On the API side, rather than looking at the return value of these
methods to determine whether they're implemented, we should just catch
NotImplementedError and return a sensible error message.

In order to do this, we need to ensure the NotImplementedError is
properly deserialized from the RemoteError which will encapsualte
it. The fix for bug #1086798 ensures this happens.

Finally, add some tests to make sure we properly respond with 501
when the virt driver doesn't implement these actions.

Change-Id: I2d4fc51a4b16d5230e61bde75915142ea450557d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of unimplemented host actions

Fixes bug #1060884

Host actions like enable/disable, maintenance mode and power management
are not implemented in most virt drivers.

In the case of set_host_enabled() in the libvirt driver, we have a no-op
implementation. In other cases we have an implementation which raises
NotImplementedError. Since the default implementation is to do this, we
should just remove the redundant methods from the drivers which don't
actually implement these actions. This ensures NotImplementedError is
consistently raised.

On the API side, rather than looking at the return value of these
methods to determine whether they're implemented, we should just catch
NotImplementedError and return a sensible error message.

In order to do this, we need to ensure the NotImplementedError is
properly deserialized from the RemoteError which will encapsualte
it. The fix for bug #1086798 ensures this happens.

Finally, add some tests to make sure we properly respond with 501
when the virt driver doesn't implement these actions.

Change-Id: I2d4fc51a4b16d5230e61bde75915142ea450557d

commit_message:
use file instead of tap for non-blockdevice images on Xen

In nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py the method pick_disk_driver_name() returns
"tap" for non-blockdevices on Xen. This leads to an exception on the
xend service. The returned driver name should be "file" instead of
"tap".

fixes bug 1084618

Change-Id: Ib87f18f56afb3c5f34c30e9aea605dad24a36cdf

commit_message:
Don't leak info from libvirt LVM backed instances

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (remove_logical_volumes):
Overwrite each logical volume with zero
(clear_logical_volume): LV obfuscation implementation.
(logical_volume_size): A utility function used by
clear_logical_volume()

Fixes bug: 1070539
Change-Id: I4e1024de8dfe9b0be3b0d6437c836d2042862f85

commit_message:
Fixed nics param ignored when bdm is specified

1. Fixed the issue of 'nics' parameter getting ignored in boot
command when block_device_mapping is specified.
2. Added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1004572

Change-Id: I1b720b8527406ee664f084167426f778793a436f

commit_message:
Quantum cleanups

* Set base default env vars in lib/quantum
* Rename common dirs to match devstack conventions
  Q_CONF_FILE -> QUANTUM_CONF
  QUANTUM_CLIENT_* -> QUANTUMCLIENT_*

Change-Id: I7a2a92b50ef953195f078ac62cb975f28892c05c

Adds support for key_pairs quota.

Updates novaclient's quota and quota_class handlers to support
the key_pairs quota that is now in Nova.

Fixes LP Bug #1084674.

Change-Id: I2156816fd09bdd388e3acb8143b041e927f33511
"}]
commit_message:
Adds support for injected_file_path_bytes quota.

Updates novaclient's quota and quota_class handlers to support
the injected_file_path_bytes quota that is now in Nova.

Fixes LP Bug #1084672.

Change-Id: I2156816fd09bdd388e3acb8143b041e927f33511

commit_message:
Revert "Stop duplicating the configuration"

This reverts commit 17b2c7ab428caf0660523fe4240c26c676b87ff1 (it was
causing regressions in stable because older stack.sh did not create
the config and relied on this).

Change-Id: I55251b80aeb176f18ce155d87c496f2e5942681f

commit_message:
Adds nova client support for nova-manage network command

Adds the following commands:
- nova network-disassociate
- nova network-associate-host
- nova network-associate-project
- nova network-create

This patch depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15491/

Change-Id: I44c7d0bf6ba545cf1ed6f6f8390bab836fe52f9d
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

commit_message:
Don't leak info from libvirt LVM backed instances

* nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py (remove_logical_volumes):
Overwrite each logical volume with zero
(clear_logical_volume): LV obfuscation implementation.
(logical_volume_size): A utility function used by
clear_logical_volume()

Fixes bug: 1070539
Change-Id: I4e1024de8dfe9b0be3b0d6437c836d2042862f85

commit_message:
Make DNS drivers inherit interface.

Updates the DNS driver implementations so they inherit
the interface. Should help catch things that aren't
implemented in the future.

Change-Id: Ic8b269c8525236c65b492c889d4530a09836bb13

'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2012-12-07 04:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve; Approved

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-12-07 12:08:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

One problem - those are not valid URLs (you can't have a ':' in the path). We need to url-escape the ARN before putting it in the path. (Also a '/' in the ARN should not become a path component in the URL.) Here is Amazon's example:

  https://cloudformation-waitcondition-test.s3.amazonaws.com/arn%3Aaws%3Acloudformation%3Aus-east-1%3A034017226601%3Astack%2Fstack-gosar-20110427004224-test-stack-with-WaitCondition--VEYW%2Fe498ce60-70a1-11e0-81a7-5081d0136786%2FmyWaitConditionHandle?Expires=1303976584&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE&Signature=ik1twT6hpS4cgNAw7wyOoRejVoo%3D


Maybe we should add an arn_url_path() function to do this, to make things symmetrical. It should be as simple as:

  return '/' + urllib.quote(self.arn())"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2012-12-10 14:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-10 14:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Move all temporary files into a single /tmp subdir.

Also setup a temporary homedir to prevent interactions with
user configuration.

This fixes bug 1088761.

Change-Id: I31f1b839593351648cd7b4fb9371562c1348fafc

commit_message:
Adds nova client support for nova-manage floating command

Adds the following commands:
- nova floating-ip-bulk-list
- nova floating-ip-bulk-create
- nova floating-ip-bulk-delete

Change-Id: Ia183a7a478d23fee3552d43a866ba96abb7472b2
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

commit_message:
Add nova client support for nova-manage account scrub command

This add a CLI in scrub in nova-client.

so we can use "nova scrub project_id" like "nova-manage account
scrub project_id".It will delete data associated with project.

Change-Id: I6e76fe4357fcdc3765f3ece70d9b6b07c23b59bd

commit_message:
Make nova/virt use aggregate['metadetails']

This patch makes nova/virt use the metadata attached to the
aggregate object instead of querying it separately. This allows
us to remove a method from VirtAPI and avoid adding another one to
conductor to support it.

Change-Id: I4b9ff59147d30ff6f71fa66e838f060b8853dc95

- http://logs.openstack.org/15485/1/check/gate-swift-python26/1032 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15485/1/check/gate-swift-python27/1034 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15485/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/17178 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-11-06 19:36:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

A few comments inline.

This was a tactical review, not touching on the question of whether or not the decreased latency between actual expiration (by time) and object-expirer getting around to doing the expiration is worth the (potential) latency increase on GETs for expired objects.  If that's a concern, this feature could be made optional."}, {'account_id': 5619, 'date': '2012-11-07 10:14:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

This implementation introduces different api-behaviours for expired objects, depending whether or not the expiration was just discovered or already known. This introduces unnecessary complexity, and arguably an information leak. (you can discover the existence of expired objects in public containers, if they haven't been reaped yet)"}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-08 06:30:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Thank you for thorough reviewing.

I think, the misbehavior of expired object deletion is not related this patch. (bug #1076245)

But, I think it's worth to reduce latency between actual expiration in an object server and actual expiration in a container server because it can reduce(actually once) chances to see phantom object in container's object list in some scenarios like this:
 1. Asking object list to container server
 2. Downloading object in the list
 3. Getting 404 response.
 4. Asking object list again to container server
 5. Expired object is not shown anymore

I think, this approach looks simpler then to change DB schema of container server(add expire-date to object table).

I'll rebase & apply the comments, and upload new patchset soon.

Thanks


@Darrel

Which should be default behavior for this feature? Updating Container or not?
IMHO, this feature should be default because 
For the situation like bulk download, there's way to turn this feature off optionally but I can't sure yet the option is necessary or not.
If the option is essential, could you give me a which way you prefer? Put additional header when request? other COMMAND? or?

@kvdveer

Could you explain a little more detail about the different api-behaviors?
Not returning 404 Status Code for expired objects is not related this patch. (bug #1076245 )
Are there any other different api or issue?"}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-08 07:40:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-08 08:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/15485/2/check/gate-swift-docs/812 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/15485/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/17653 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5619, 'date': '2012-11-08 12:50:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

I didn't explain my point very well, sorry. I'll try again.

Your change introduces a behavioral change with the retrieval of expired objects. Previously, requesting an expired object would result in '404 Not Found', which is identical to what you'd get if you requested a non-existing object.

With your change, requesting an expired object would result in '404 Not Found(expired)'. This is a low-risk information leak, which is not strictly necessary. If the proxy cleans up the 'expiredness' information from the object server response, the information leak is gone.

I also agree with Darell Bisshop's inline comments. Using the http status line to communicate 'expiredness' feels like a hack. Headers are far more suitable for this.

On the topic of the tradeoff between the delay introduced and the feature added: The delay is only introduced when an object is requested which is expired but not yet reaped. I think is is an acceptable tradeof, as that scenario is quite rare. On the other hand: requesting an object list _after_ accessing an object is even rarer, so this patch really doesn't affect said chances anyway."}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-09 08:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-09 08:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Instead of introducing new status reason, putting expired information to body of HTTPNotFound response.

At first, I'd like to put the information to headers, but the headers is eaten by swift.proxy.controllers.base:Controller.best_response(). So I chose to put the information in status reason.

However, putting them in body looks better, so I changed.

And, I think, listing of container's (expired) objects is relatively quite often if user use browsers of swift or clouldfile browser like cyberduck."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-09 08:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5619, 'date': '2012-11-09 12:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Not using the status line is definitly an improvement, but you still didn't address the information leak concern; regular 404 and expired 404 are now distinguishable through the body. You seem reluctant to use headers, could you indicate why?

(assigning no score, as I don't think my opinion on this low-impact information leak is important enough to stall this feature)"}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-12 09:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-12 09:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Rebasing.

@kvdveer

While processing a request in proxy(swift.proxy.controllers.base), headers of 404 responses is not accessible. I do yarn to put the expired information to response headers, but for that, I should change the policy of response handling of proxy server. So, I chose to use bodies for least changing.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-12 09:42:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-11-12 14:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Do not merge

This patch would have the proxy send object-deletions to container servers whenever an expired object has been GET requested.

1) What about the other verbs (though obviously PUT would override the deletion status).

2) Doing a container+object delete stamped at the current time from proxy, in other words, making stuff up, is a bad idea. There's a small race condition where an object can be PUT but then not be in the container listing because of this.

3) I don't see how this solves the stated problem. How many people do a GET of all their objects and then list them? I suppose if you were serving them all via CDN and they were all pretty active that this would work, but considering the client has to handle the case of "objects in listing may no longer exist in cluster" anyway (even without the expired objects feature)...'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-11-27 17:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Restored

I've been concentrating on other projects these days, I couldn't follow the review.

Anyway, thank you for reviewing this.

At first, many people said this kind of hack is not suitable for the bug, so I'll change the way.

Before making new patch, I'd like to hear other people's opinion about my approach.
 - Adding new field delete_at in container's object table
 - Notifying the change of a value of delete_at of objects to container. 
 - This patch may change ContainerBroker.get_db_version() which will return 2 to work with old versions.
 - I'll use suitable timestamp than current time if possible.

Or, the behavior of the bug is intentional, so there's nothing to do?"}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-12-11 04:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

Abandon until how to fix the bug come to an agreement.
(Actually, this bug might not be fixed.)'}]

commit_message:
Reduce chances of expired object listing of container

When an object has been expired, the container server will still list
the object until the object expirer delete the object.
In this patch, the proxy server will notify the container server when
expired object is accessed via GET method.
The response of GET verb for expired object from object server
has "404 Not Found" status with body "Expired".
Therefore, the phantom file listing of container can be reduced by
relatively little overhead of updating.

Fixes: bug #1069849
Change-Id: I9a73bd51ce4e40b6e63bf1c06b4de6b41574cb44

Updates the use_keyring option for the Keystone Client class
to default to False by default. This provides for a much
easier upgrade path the the most recent keystone-client code
and is backwards compatible with the previous release.

This does not change the default of the no_cache keystone CLI
which will still enable use_keyring by default.

Fixes LP Bug #1087434.

Change-Id: Iaafadde660b0542a9c0a9c1bb742cb369b523a68
'}]
commit_message:
Make use_keyring False by default.

Updates the use_keyring option for the Keystone Client class
to default to False by default. This provides for a much
easier upgrade path the the most recent keystone-client code
and is backwards compatible with the previous release.

This does not change the default of the no_cache keystone CLI
which will still enable use_keyring by default.

Fixes LP Bug #1087434.

Change-Id: Iaafadde660b0542a9c0a9c1bb742cb369b523a68

This looks like a copy of the same migration from master, with the same migration number.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-11-27 03:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

regard this as a backport.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-27 22:37:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

http://wiki.openstack.org/StableBranch

We generally do not allow migrations to be backported to the stable branch except in this case we might be able to do it because it's the same migration number that got merged on master

The main issue would be that users would have to know to run the migration when they upgrade - that has never been needed before with a stable branch release, so I'd really rather avoid it

The summary is that this would only be justified if was an absolutely critical issue for Folsom users - there is little in the way of such justification here, so if you think it's a massively important fix then please explain that in some detail

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-11-28 04:35:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FWIW, if you got the latest stable/folsom with this backport included, and then *didn't* run db_sync, nothing would be necessarily broken... you just wouldn't have UTF-8 support.

I'd also wager that the majority of openstack users that need UTF-8 support would have already applied a similar fix to their own databases manually... making this fix more for applicable to users starting with a fresh deployment from stable/folsom."}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-12-11 02:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2012-12-10 23:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix bw_usage_update issue with conductor

During a rebase, the tests for the conductor's implementation of
bw_usage_*() were lost. This caused some later changes to go
untested, and thus, introduce errors. This patch:

1. Fixes the calling order of bw_usage_get() from LocalAPI
2. Fixes the test used to determine if an update should be performed
3. Fixes the RPC API version number that should have been bumped
4. Adds the tests

Yikes.

Change-Id: I87c8ad19002d7cc420dc15f6ae21c6bfcbb0ee53

During a rebase, the tests for the conductor's implementation of
bw_usage_*() were lost. This caused some later changes to go
untested, and thus, introduce errors. This patch:

1. Fixes the calling order of bw_usage_get() from LocalAPI
2. Fixes the test used to determine if an update should be performed
3. Fixes the RPC API version number that should have been bumped
4. Adds the tests

Yikes.

Change-Id: I87c8ad19002d7cc420dc15f6ae21c6bfcbb0ee53

commit_message:
Fix bw_usage_update issue with conductor

During a rebase, the tests for the conductor's implementation of
bw_usage_*() were lost. This caused some later changes to go
untested, and thus, introduce errors. This patch:

1. Fixes the calling order of bw_usage_get() from LocalAPI
2. Fixes the test used to determine if an update should be performed
3. Fixes the RPC API version number that should have been bumped
4. Adds the tests

Yikes.

Change-Id: I87c8ad19002d7cc420dc15f6ae21c6bfcbb0ee53

commit_message:
Eventlet monkey-patch heat-api

I have a stress test which uses python-heatclient to create
an empty template, list the stacks, and delete the created stack.

Running 100 of these jobs concurrently takes 64 seconds without this patch,
and 17 seconds with it.

Change-Id: I8963da477aa8fcec724e2e5afcd5ec92ff5b07d1

 af18eaa Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
 f21e1d9 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments
 ceb4aa7 Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts
 5e9503b Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes
 b6d24bb updating sphinx documentation
 403509e Don't reference argparse._StoreAction
 e17deb8 Fix minor coding style issue
 0c29e1d Remove ConfigCliParser class

 5afead0 Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()
 5f564b2 argparse support for cfg

The main API change affecting keystone is that CONF() no longer returns
unparsed arguments. The keystone-manage command is updated to use
argparse sub-parsers to achieve the same effect.

commit_message:
Port to argparse based cfg

Sync the following changes from oslo-incubator:

 3557d84 Fix ListOpt to trim whitespace
 01ab910 Fix set_default() with boolean CLI options
 af18eaa Improve cfg's argparse sub-parsers support
 f21e1d9 Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments
 ceb4aa7 Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts
 5e9503b Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes
 b6d24bb updating sphinx documentation
 403509e Don't reference argparse._StoreAction
 e17deb8 Fix minor coding style issue
 0c29e1d Remove ConfigCliParser class
 5b9cb41 Add support for positional arguments
 dbc72a6 Use stock argparse behaviour for optional args
 768a147 Use stock argparse --usage behaviour
 ac180b9 Use stock argparse --version behaviour
 0787e38 Remove add_option() method
 5afead0 Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()
 5f564b2 argparse support for cfg
 d7b6397 Add a missing comma in a docstring.
 aca1805 cfg: fix required if option has a dash

The main API change affecting keystone is that CONF() no longer returns
unparsed arguments. The keystone-manage command is updated to use
argparse sub-parsers to achieve the same effect.

Change-Id: Ie8972ce851f1247d8710e9e0611bb3e2f843cb45

to virt/baremetal/driver:spawn(). This will ensure that it is

Change-Id: I6a16f574e3923d2134a9de1f6ebd015251238898

commit_message:
multi-node compute should set instance['node']

In the last week or so, compute stopped passing 'node' properly
to virt/baremetal/driver:spawn(). This will ensure that it is
properly set as a member of instance.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: I6a16f574e3923d2134a9de1f6ebd015251238898

commit_message:
Add test to simply run a few binaries

This is not really a unit test, but it's so fast that I think it could
be considered as such. And it would be nice to gate on such blatant
breakage.

Change-Id: I8ff4ca27a912c30bd962168418ac44217ea9e54d
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set default DNS driver to No-op.

In 522ac62 we set the default network DNS driver to MiniDNS
which was primarily meant for testing only.

This patch adds a NoopDNSDriver and updates the Nova default
to use it.

Fixes LP Bug #1088603.

Change-Id: Id3bdf86e0ea16fc6d4490436afbabc7a95cf820b

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Akihiro has a good point about the empty list.
I think gongysh is proposing this patch for allowing the other change he's proposing on the CLI side to work smoothly.

It's not the first time I see an attempt to change the API for suiting the CLI needs. While I am strongly opposed to this approach, I also see some merit in this proposal regardless of the CLI change, as we want to have a consistent way of clearing an attribute. As we allow gateway_ip to be cleared by setting it to null in the JSON payload, it makes sense to do the same for these attributes.

However, for the sake of consistency, I would like that all the clearable attributes across the API would behave in the same way. There's no need for doing it in this patch, but we need to track the issue.

I want to ensure the change will preserve backard compatibility before approving."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I have one question about this fix.

quantum-server before this patch accepts an empty list [] as a valid input. So I think we don't modify quantum-server to clear dns_nameservers or host_routes (i.e., passing []). The problem is that quantum CLI has no way to specify an empty list. To fix this bug, we just need to change quantumclient.

When a commandline is "quantum subnet-update <subnet_id> --dns_nameservers list=true None", if quantumclient passes [] to quantum server, the bug will fix I believe.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I also see the client side patch.

My question is why quantum client needs to pass None (null in json) instead of [] to the quantum server. Isn't it sufficient to pass [] from client library to quantum server?"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

convert_non_to_empty_list should have tests"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

quantum subnet-update a4d5ee98-d64b-4b25-930e-7ca2ed8a5207 --host_routes list=true type=dict destination=9.0.1.0/24,nexthop=9.0.1.1
the command below will reset the host_routes: quantum subnet-update a4d5ee98-d64b-4b25-930e-7ca2ed8a5207 --host_routes
client pathc is at: https://review.openstack.org/17436'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There is no many attributes which is meaningful to set the value to empty. the dns_nameservers and host_routes are good candidates. gateway_ip is too. maybe we should add Name attr.

To be consistent, I think:
First, we should be able to accept the Json None (maybe xml nil?) value from API client for any attr,

Second, we should be able to convert it to proper value. (optional)

third, we should be able to let the converted(if step second) or original None value pass validation.

forth, plugin codes should be able to process the converted value or original None as db value null if we are using DB.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Don't set the dns managers

Revert to previous behavior, pick up whatever is set as default
in nova. This was causing an issue in a tempest run. Tempest has
a test where multiple servers can be spun up with the same name
this test failed.

Change-Id: Ie71eda94caf38db0489d6b2385dc80808a39864d

Nice!  I guess that's where the SIGPIPE carping was coming from when running unit tests with Python 2.7..."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

My only concern w/this change is the possibility of legit problems getting swallowed silently by eventlet.

If this were configurable via the relevant conf file (defaulting to the values in this patch--i.e. quiet), we could enable it for development/testing, while keeping production clusters quieter.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Which traceback is this now?  When I have a client disconnect during a GET all I see is:

Dec  6 16:47:40 localhost proxy-server 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.1 06/Dec/2012/22/47/40 GET /v1/AUTH_test/hub_error/test.out HTTP/1.0 499 - curl/7.19.7%20%28i486-pc-linux-gnu%29%20libcurl/7.19.7%20OpenSSL/0.9.8k%20zlib/1.2.3.3%20libidn/1.15 test%2CAUTH_tk7f7acb5d38484431a3b753dd304032d2 - 25296896 - txe381c5ea2b6d4de2b6834b93a1cfbae4 - 1.0797 -
Dec  6 16:47:40 localhost proxy-server Client disconnected on read (txn: txe381c5ea2b6d4de2b6834b93a1cfbae4) (client_ip: 127.0.0.1)
Dec  6 16:48:40 localhost proxy-server Client did not read from queue within 60s (txn: txe381c5ea2b6d4de2b6834b93a1cfbae4) (client_ip: 127.0.0.1)

Does this somehow fix the chunked transfer disconnect?!

I was really curious which section of eventlet you're seeing the exception pop in?  It seems like despite the docstring, this change will "squelch" exceptions raised from a few places in the hub, not just timers...

Is there a bug associated with this where I could get more info?'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-07 16:41:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Darrell:  Yeah I can see your concern, will need to explore that a little futher.

Clay:  I reproduced the issue by using swift client to download a large file and CTRL-C in the middle.  I hadn't created a bug, just something that has bugged me forever when looking through prod logs."}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-07 19:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-07 19:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-07 20:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Thanks for making it configurable!  I'd have kept the default behavior as what happens now (i.e. enabled by default), but I'm fine either way."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-12-08 23:05:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

So, I was all mixed up looking at the squelch methods in eventlet.hubs.hub cause I thought these were "hub_exceptions" - it took me awhile to find the if DEBUG check in  greenpool.GreenPool._spawn_n_impl that was actually printing the traceback.  Ryan wisely flipped the default module constant DEBUG to True shortly after 0.9.7, but the reason I wasn't seeing them on Lucid was the difference in SocketServer between py2.6 and py2.7 - basically the StreamRequestHandler will now call "finish" in a finally block (which will attempt to flush before closing the socket) - so the socket.error is now being raised again outside of where eventlet.wsgi was expecting to catch it.  Here's a patch:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/27646/

It's funny cause we actually monkeypatch a few things on eventlet.wsgi.HttpProtocol already in run_server, PLUS it's actually parametrized when you create the server if you want, so it'd be easy to workaround in swift directly even w/o the upstream change...

Anyway, I guess I think I understand a little better what's going on with the spawn_n exception gobbling.  And since you can't do anything to trap them on the outside of a spawn_n, I guess it's sometimes helpful to just turn them off?  It's interesting how Greg's Army Queue works around the fact that spawn_n threads can't raise exceptions.  I stuck a NameError in _make_app_iter_reader and man it's a good thing we can turn these back on in dev :)

Anyway, the only reason I didn't +2 on this is because the account reaper also uses GreenPool, so I still guess I'd recommend you add this eventlet_debug setting handling in run_daemon rather than the __init__ of "every daemon that uses GreenPools" to keep it more DRY and consistent with what you did in run_wsgi.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-10 16:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-10 16:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Good point clay.  I've updated the patch to set the debug in swift/common/daemon.py"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-10 16:51:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Add config option to turn eventlet debug on/off

By default, this will be turned off.  This will cause eventlet to not
print stack traces to stderr which can be very annoying on production
systems.  It is still recommended to turn it on for development or
debuging purposes.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5e5b902d3d9ed85f784549e53f2ee2fc87cbe2e5

"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do the relative paths break any installation? I am not sure if it's considered "wrong" otherwise if the config files land in a relative path.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Making the paths absolute causes problems when folks want to install into a virtualenv.  This seems like a distro packaging problem, I'd need more information on why we want to force the location of files."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, I agree. This has to be solved differently. The issue is that distros use indeed a prefix (/usr), but install configuration files in /etc. That's somewhat different to when you use the prefix /usr/local, or a virtualenv or ~/.local. It's a special case for the "site" Python module, which is actually the general case for every distro.'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The general idea is correct, but config files destined for /etc are somewhat of an exception. Right now they would land in /usr/etc, which is wrong. This should happen for every distribution package (would have to check that, still). So what we (and potentially everone else) do is fixing this in our RPM spec file. Which is ok as I don't see a cleaner solution ATM."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Solved differently'}]

[{'created': '2012-12-10 20:14:30.000000000', 'message': "Paths for data_files in setup.py should be absolute.

Relative paths are interpreted relative to the installation prefix and
thus don't land in /etc but in /usr/etc (if prefix = /usr), which is
wrong. See
http://docs.python.org/2/distutils/setupscript.html#installing-additional-files

Change-Id: I5de5fa99a259c960540ce263109b0ab9ff2cedf0
"}]
commit_message:
Paths for data_files in setup.py should be absolute.

Relative paths are interpreted relative to the installation prefix and
thus don't land in /etc but in /usr/etc (if prefix = /usr), which is
wrong. See
http://docs.python.org/2/distutils/setupscript.html#installing-additional-files

Change-Id: I5de5fa99a259c960540ce263109b0ab9ff2cedf0

This patch moves bw_usage operations from compute manager
to conductor. In an effort to reduce the number of API points
we're adding to the conductor RPC API, this patch actually
only adds an update function, which also returns the current
values. This is used by the public conductor API layer to provide
both get and update calls through a single remote function.
Discussion and comments on this approach are welcomed.

commit_message:
Use conductor for bw_usage operations

This patch moves bw_usage operations from compute manager
to conductor. In an effort to reduce the number of API points
we're adding to the conductor RPC API, this patch actually
only adds an update function, which also returns the current
values. This is used by the public conductor API layer to provide
both get and update calls through a single remote function.
Discussion and comments on this approach are welcomed.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Iabe4cef2bccc8ffcf0ddc76bf7b328c2c4d87112

commit_message:
Use fixtures library for nova test fixtures.

Moving the test-case setup and teardown code into managed fixtures
so that we can better interact with them when we start running things
in parallel.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I406be0a88b14c0dba2d22b4957e26a53442bbae3

'}, {'created': '2012-12-08 00:28:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fname concurrency tests.

It was possible for thread2 to run before thread1 in the fname
concurrency tests. When this happens the assertions in the fname
concurrency tests fail. In each fname test block until thread 1 signals
the test before creating thread 2. In the different fname test block

commit_message:
Fix fname concurrency tests.

It was possible for thread2 to run before thread1 in the fname
concurrency tests. When this happens the assertions in the fname
concurrency tests fail. In each fname test block until thread 1 signals
the test before creating thread 2. In the different fname test block
until thread 2 signals the test before beginning the actual test work.

This ensures everyone has started as expected before checking the
expected done values.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I119fb03423324c9db9847b97d9bb69e71fef2aad

commit_message:
Unpin lxml requirements

Ubuntu is using a much newer version of lxml so
we shouldn't lock the versions in our infrasctructure.

Change-Id: I688c0be196db526f220262e25afa79d84fcae632

commit_message:
libvirt: enable apic setting for Xen or KVM guest.

Bug 1086352

Currently, nova doesn't enable apic setting for Xen or KVM guest
in its libvirt driver. Windows guests would not boot successful in
such case. This patch adds apic setting in libvirt driver for Xen
or KVM guest, which would fix this problem. A check is also added
to libvirt guest config test case for this patch.

Change-Id: Ie213c9d086f77faf0cdc5a32337c5bf4b828cf5f

commit_message:
Don't pass -1 as a stack_id in unit tests

We now use UUIDs as stack IDs, but in most cases even that is not
necessary.

Change-Id: I0ef4efb5c3289c6c3d0fd3d0232118c0e906f8b5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-12-07 12:55:16.000000000', 'message': 'exercises/euca: Fix volume timeout

Fixes bug 1087656

In euca exercise, the timeout for one of the volume operations was
specified as ASSOCIATE_TIMEOUT, whereas the timeout error message was
mentioning RUNNING_TIMEOUT. This fix changes the timeout to
RUNNING_TIMEOUT so that it is consistent with the error message.

As RUNNING is usually larger than ASSOCIATE, it leaves more time for the
volume operation.

Change-Id: Ic016c7920ae6e4ec9a476bb5612b7df9eed01c75
'}]
commit_message:
exercises/euca: Fix volume timeout

Fixes bug 1087656

In euca exercise, the timeout for one of the volume operations was
specified as ASSOCIATE_TIMEOUT, whereas the timeout error message was
mentioning RUNNING_TIMEOUT. This fix changes the timeout to
RUNNING_TIMEOUT so that it is consistent with the error message.

As RUNNING is usually larger than ASSOCIATE, it leaves more time for the
volume operation.

Change-Id: Ic016c7920ae6e4ec9a476bb5612b7df9eed01c75

commit_message:
Rename --no_cache to --os_cache.

Some changes to make keystoneclient more backwards compatible
by disabling key caching by default.

This patch renames the CLI option for when to use the
auth token cache to --os-cache and sets it to False by default.

It also changes the ENV variable to OS_CACHE (instead of OS_NO_CACHE).

Change-Id: I6e549feec6ee7500e398a1eceb5bb44cd7d40347

commit_message:
Access DB values as dict not as attributes. Part 4

We cannot assume nova.db.api will be returning sqlalchemy objects
attributes, instead treat return values as dicts

Part of blueprint db-api-cleanup

The downside to this is that if resetswift fails (doesn't exist, written incorrectly, w/e) it could be quite fun trying to track it down."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hrmm... so that's a good point, I wasn't thinking of using probetests as a way to identify issues with a mis-copy-and-pasted resetswift script.

FWIW, if the script doesn't exist you get an OSError (ENOENT) from subprocess.call, nose will throw stack, and the test(s) will fail.

But here's my thought...

If I'm running a branch through an automated deploy/test cycle and probetests fail - it's probably *not* the resetswift script, and having all that output in the test log just seems like noise?

Still "prettier dots" is a pretty low value add.  Any suggestions how to make this patch better at solving my intended goal w/o making it harder to use probetests?  Maybe I should just abandon, I can always revisit when we have automated tests logs if it's actually a problem...'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-11-27 15:32:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Eh, I'm fine either way so I didn't put in a score. Just figured I'd mention it in case somebody really, really cares. :) I don't think anybody but me (and I guess you!) run these things anyway."}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2012-12-03 17:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Would it be possible to add a -v flag or something like that so that you could run it seeing the issues if the reset fails?  I like suppressing the output, but I know it would be nice to debug if things are failing. (And tell users to run when they are trying but fail)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-12-03 17:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This change makes the dots prettier during probetests

When calling the resetswift script, the probetests will use subprocess
to redirect stderr to stdout and capture stdout into a buffer.  We print
the captured buffer from resetswift's combined stdout/stderr and let

Change-Id: I022512f2ef5a4c43b0e49264bad1bca98c1f0299
"}]
commit_message:
capture resetswift output in probetests

This change makes the dots prettier during probetests

When calling the resetswift script, the probetests will use subprocess
to redirect stderr to stdout and capture stdout into a buffer.  We print
the captured buffer from resetswift's combined stdout/stderr and let
nosetests stdout capturing handle printing the output for debug only if a
test fails.

Change-Id: I022512f2ef5a4c43b0e49264bad1bca98c1f0299

[{'created': '2012-11-26 21:23:46.000000000', 'message': "Add config of server start timeouts for probetests

Currently the timeout for a wsgi server successfully binding to a port
and for a probetest background service to finish starting are hard coded
to 30 seconds.  While a reasonable default for most configurations, a
small virtualized environment may need a little more time in order for
probe tests to complete successfully.

This patch adds a 'bind_timeout' option to the DEFAULT section of the
main wsgi servers' config.  Also a new [probe_test] section and
'check_server_timeout' option to test.conf

Change-Id: Ibcaff153c7633bbf32e460fd9dbf04932eddb56f

commit_message:
Add config of server start timeouts for probetests

Currently the timeout for a wsgi server successfully binding to a port
and for a probetest background service to finish starting are hard coded
to 30 seconds.  While a reasonable default for most configurations, a
small virtualized environment may need a little more time in order for
probe tests to complete successfully.

This patch adds a 'bind_timeout' option to the DEFAULT section of the
main wsgi servers' config.  Also a new [probe_test] section and
'check_server_timeout' option to test.conf

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibcaff153c7633bbf32e460fd9dbf04932eddb56f

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError in dns_driver.DNSDriver.

Updates dns_driver.DNSDriver so that we raise NotImplementedError
instead of returning empty result sets or passing. Since this
class is the default dns_driver for Nova it can be quite
confusing when it returns empty results (which actually
causes some HTTP 500 errors as well).

We really need to switch the default floating/instance
dns managers to MiniDNS as smoketests fail otherwise we
currently use nova.network.dns_driver.DNSDriver which is
not correct

Fixes LP Bug #1040236
Fixes LP Bug #1027998

Change-Id: Id818bb00e0689d96db948872842c07d2cf1edd57

commit_message:
Add dispersion report flags to limit reports

- Add two optional flags that let you limit swift-dispersion-report to only
reporting on containers OR objects.
- Also make dispersion.conf and swift-dispersion-report manpages
  current.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iad56133cad261241db27d0e2103098e3c2f3c245

commit_message:
Add a timestamp to the log output for better diagnosis

when we are looking at logs generated by the gate jobs
we need timestamps on the output of stack.sh so we can
figure out what was being executed around the time when
there was a problem in say nova-network

Change-Id: I203e8dae97715d6ee46a4088c7577b9be66cf09d

subject: Don't display exceptions when instance is not found
messages:
[{'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-merge/13538 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-docs/9256 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/14566 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-python26/10704 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-python27/10776 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21347 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17642/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/3979 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is there a way we can still log the calling method that triggered the failure. I know in one of the bug examples it turns out to be an improperly defined decorator (not setting the func.__name__ right), but I think being able to track down where it was called from is useful, perhaps send method_name or something in kwargs and log that as well.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-06 22:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jason, is there another spot in the codebase where this is done? (to copy code from!)

thanks,
dims'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Cells uses something similar, but I forget what the review ids for it is, its in cells_api.py.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:26:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

To fix those bugs, we should fix the reason the exceptions are being generated in the first place, not suppress their display by changing them to debug messages. The exception is necessary so we can see where the call came from that generated this exception. I would prefer we left it in place. Is it always from the heal cache call? Without the exception we would never know.."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-07 00:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"fix the reason the exceptions are being generated". the reason is that the test case nukes the instance as part of that refresh_cache is run and the refresh_cache tries to update all instances in the cache one of which we deleted...'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-07 02:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jason,

Is this the review you mentioned? https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15228/ it does have a cells_api.py but did not spot anything in it that i can use'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-12-07 04:04:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yea, _cast_to_cells is what sends the method name to the other side of the rpc, I was thinking in the exception where an exception is raised with the method_name it used that across the rpc layer to see who called it, but its local, sorry for the misdirect there ;).

I just hate to remove the logging here of where the call is coming from as a few things use the refresh_cache decorator (some of them user facing) and losing where its coming from makes it hard to debug all the interesting ways users find their instance into a particular state ;).

To just suppress this for just cache_heal operations, I'd try to tackle this by adding a kwarg of cache_heal=False to the refresh_cache call in the api like this https://gist.github.com/8f8b04df1ddb49cb120b so that we can have the best of both worlds."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-07 13:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-12-10 12:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 22:08:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't display exceptions when instance is not found

Just before refresh_cache code kicks in, we have already deleted
the instance. update_instance_cache_with_nw_info tries to find it
and fails. Just stop printing exceptions and log a debug message

Fixes LP #1084698

Change-Id: Ia2f1e6833898ac38973240c50d6cb1da5ddca198
"}, {'created': '2012-12-06 22:16:56.000000000', 'message': "Don't display exceptions when instance is not found

Just before refresh_cache code kicks in, we have already deleted
the instance. update_instance_cache_with_nw_info tries to find it
and fails. Just stop printing exceptions and log a debug message

Fixes LP #1084698
Fixes LP #1084699

Change-Id: Ia2f1e6833898ac38973240c50d6cb1da5ddca198
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display exceptions when instance is not found

Just before refresh_cache code kicks in, we have already deleted
the instance. update_instance_cache_with_nw_info tries to find it
and fails. Just stop printing exceptions and log a debug message

Fixes LP #1084698
Fixes LP #1084699

Change-Id: Ia2f1e6833898ac38973240c50d6cb1da5ddca198

commit_message:
show swap disk in listing and forms in flavors syspanel

At the moment the swap disk entry of flavors is not listed in
the syspanel listing of flavors and it's not possible to create
a new flavor or edit an existing flavor with the swap size

Change-Id: I92195671024bb361fa5825cbdcea515850ddee31

commit_message:
Add a check for unlimited quotas

This extra check will prevent Horizon to misunderstand "-1" value when tallying quotas,
setting the "Available" field to inf instead of 0.

Fixes: bug #1084976
Change-Id: Ib316a15ac8ffa8ed4e4c51c02d5956db57fb6f6e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 05:18:43.000000000', 'message': "Allow permissions to be set on tables

Sometimes we want to hide certain UI elements depending on the
permissions granted to the current user. At the moment this is
possible for Actions and Panels. This commit extends support to
DataTable too.

We also set the permission on the volume snapshots table so that,
like the volumes panel, it is only displayed when the 'volume'
service is active.

Fixes bug #1087128.

Change-Id: Icc12b479c3eb888320af735b8b7810e58517eef0
"}]
commit_message:
Allow permissions to be set on tables

Sometimes we want to hide certain UI elements depending on the
permissions granted to the current user. At the moment this is
possible for Actions and Panels. This commit extends support to
DataTable too.

We also set the permission on the volume snapshots table so that,
like the volumes panel, it is only displayed when the 'volume'
service is active.

Fixes bug #1087128.

Change-Id: Icc12b479c3eb888320af735b8b7810e58517eef0

commit_message:
Further fleshing out of hwdiscovery element

This adds support for other elements to feed into the hwdiscovery
results.

It also fixes a few bugs in the construction of the ramdisk.

It also adds support for specifying a server to POST the discovered
hardware data to, via the kernel command line

Change-Id: I163db2b1388f908880e8f458e16906fa6f9db7bc

commit_message:
Test to provide read/write acl to the container

Adds two test cases to "test_container_services.py" so as to validate
the special read/write acl metadata of the container and also added
methods to make container readable/writable for specifed user
account in "container_client.py"

Change-Id: I81f26399965f07fc135c794ecfa10289a88c579c
Implements: blueprint add-some-functional-swift-tests

commit_message:
Make the nbd mounter respect CONF.max_nbd_devices.

We need to wait for the config parser to have been run before we
query the value of the max_nbd_devices flag. We will always get
the default value with the previous implementation.

Based on a conversation with Robert Collins. Resolves bug 1088073.

Change-Id: If7b5d6a5c7d8153530e97532aad67c42e744ffec

commit_message:
Add --insecure option to fix bug #1077869

If enable this option , swift CLI is allowed to access a keystone
server with self signed certificate.

Change-Id: I5e219fe875b246b68ac51a077e7ff15e95463adf

commit_message:
import hacking check tool from nova

nova has checking tool for HACKING.rst.
This tool is valuable for reviewing including
automatically checking for import order or use of except:
etc.,

How to use
./run_test.sh -H

implements bp import-nova-hacking-check-tool

Change-Id: I59f7e874af71f69c024bd966f702fef115806ab8

subject: Use conductor for migration_get()
messages:
[{'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2012-12-07 17:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-07 17:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-merge/13577 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-docs/9295 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/14605 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-python26/10743 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-python27/10815 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21425 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/4015 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-12-07 20:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This brings up some interesting questions ...

None of these uses of migration_get() should ever run unless it receives a message from an older version of nova (say, grizzly receiving a folsom message).

One way to get rid of these db API calls is to rev the compute rpc API version to 3.0 before the grizzly release.  We did the same thing before Folsom (did a rev to 2.0 and removed a bunch of backwards compatibilitiy code).

In the ideal world we want to get to, for the purposes of live upgrades, release X should always be able to handle messages from release X-1.  But will we have enough pieces in place for Grizzly to make this matter?

If live ugprades can't happen anyway because of other reasons, then we might as well bump it to the 3.0 before the release.

Then again, just because other pieces aren't ready doesn't mean we *shouldn't* be trying to always do things "right" in other areas.

HRM!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-12-07 20:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ideally, we're going to rev the wireline format before the grizzly release so that we have a *hope* of supporting this post-grizzly, right? So, IMHO, revving to 3 now is free, given the chaos that the wireline change will cause. Right?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-12-08 16:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The new rev of the wireline patch is now backwards compatible.

After thinking about it some more, I don't see any harm in this going in.  The only benefit of not doing it if we were to rev to 3.0 in the compute rpc api is that it's one less method in the conductor rpc api.  But I don't think we're talking about enough methods for this to make a big deal.  Migrations, block device mappings ... I think that may be it."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-12-09 06:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-09 06:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-09 06:38:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/gate/gate-nova-merge/13626 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/gate/gate-nova-docs/9344 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/gate/gate-nova-pep8/14654 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/gate/gate-nova-python26/10792 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/17695/1/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21514 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-09 06:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

Change-Id: Ia7df121971b14b1eb4ce65063246968b3603309d
'}]
commit_message:
Use conductor for migration_get()

This patch removes direct database accesses for looking up
migrations by id, and instead queries conductor.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Ia7df121971b14b1eb4ce65063246968b3603309d

commit_message:
Pin lxml to 3.0.1

Bump lxml to 3.0.1. This is the most recent version available
and what it is installed by default on Ubuntu 13.04. Most modern
distributions will be updating to this version sooner or later.

Change-Id: I5afdd12b79776a78b714eb605886c17a4becd295
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

setup quantum-rootrwapper

Add quantum-rootwrapper for /etc/sudoers.d
This is needed to run quantum in CI env

Change-Id: Ib59351c106f0a45bb45476edf032c97744873923

commit_message:
Enable the correct instance managers for instance/floating ips.

Currently the default is nova.network.dns_driver.DNSDriver for
both. We need to switch to nova.network.minidns.MiniDNS for
both instance_dns_manager and floating_ip_dns_manager.
nova.network.dns_driver.DNSDriver is just the interface, we
need a good implementation as the default

Fixes LP #1040236

Change-Id: If6e65cb1c7802b1ba0c1e64d4c06185cabf9eeca

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-05 23:14:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix positional arg swallow decorator

The update() method in the hosts extension is decorated with @check_host
but the function returned by decorator takes a kwarg which shadows the
'body' positional arg of the update() method.

i.e. if you call:

  controller.update(req, id, body)

then the body arg gets passed to the wrapper as its service kwarg and
never passed through to update(). We can see how the tests are all
passing body as a kwarg to avoid this.

Remove the service arg from check_host() but also from _list_hosts()
since the only place it is used is in the tests.

Change-Id: I12aab582c15c25fd35ecda005341291450c7efdc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix positional arg swallow decorator

The update() method in the hosts extension is decorated with @check_host
but the function returned by decorator takes a kwarg which shadows the
'body' positional arg of the update() method.

i.e. if you call:

  controller.update(req, id, body)

then the body arg gets passed to the wrapper as its service kwarg and
never passed through to update(). We can see how the tests are all
passing body as a kwarg to avoid this.

Remove the service arg from check_host() but also from _list_hosts()
since the only place it is used is in the tests.

Change-Id: I12aab582c15c25fd35ecda005341291450c7efdc

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 01:11:45.000000000', 'message': 'Order instance faults by created_at and id.

It is possible that instance faults have the same created_at values so
ordering on that field alone is not deterministic. Add an additional
order by clause to order descending on id as well.

I am not sure if the order by exists to make tests pass; however,
without the additional "id" the tests do occasionally fail. See
http://logs.openstack.org/15078/18/check/gate-nova-python26/10709/console.html
for an example failure. If order does not actually matter we may want to
make the test smarter instead.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I1c7a07669846c832270631c1734dae509dba7586
'}]
commit_message:
Order instance faults by created_at and id.

It is possible that instance faults have the same created_at values so
ordering on that field alone is not deterministic. Add an additional
order by clause to order descending on id as well.

I am not sure if the order by exists to make tests pass; however,
without the additional "id" the tests do occasionally fail. See
http://logs.openstack.org/15078/18/check/gate-nova-python26/10709/console.html
for an example failure. If order does not actually matter we may want to
make the test smarter instead.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I1c7a07669846c832270631c1734dae509dba7586

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 19:33:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix network manager ipv6 tests.

When using a test runner that runs tests in a different order than
nosetests it is possible that IPv6AccountIdentiferTestCase tests run
before CommonNetworkTestCase. If this happens
IPv6AccountIdentiferTestCase sets the ipv6_backend to account_identifier
which causes the regexes in
CommonNetworkTestCase.test_get_instance_uuids_by_ipv6_regex to not
match.

Explicitly set the ipv6_backend to rfc2462 in CommonNetworkTestCase's
setUp() to ensure the regex's match the addresses in the fake network
DB.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0fdb5c3d4130c6cf23b22bca6645581f603a79c5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix network manager ipv6 tests.

When using a test runner that runs tests in a different order than
nosetests it is possible that IPv6AccountIdentiferTestCase tests run
before CommonNetworkTestCase. If this happens
IPv6AccountIdentiferTestCase sets the ipv6_backend to account_identifier
which causes the regexes in
CommonNetworkTestCase.test_get_instance_uuids_by_ipv6_regex to not
match.

Explicitly set the ipv6_backend to rfc2462 in CommonNetworkTestCase's
setUp() to ensure the regex's match the addresses in the fake network
DB.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I0fdb5c3d4130c6cf23b22bca6645581f603a79c5

commit_message:
Add deprecated --logdir common opt

--logfile and --logdir are aliases Nova has for the --log-file and
--log-dir. If we're to support --logfile as a deprecated common
option, we should do the same for --logdir.

Change-Id: I16485a93070d9ad7789a287d5b035c6f270ffead

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 23:17:55.000000000', 'message': "Make ignore_hosts and force_hosts work again

Fixes bug 1087807

A recent refactor of scheduling filters and weights broke the
ignore_hosts and force_hosts functionality.  The refactored code would
have only worked if a list of host names (strings) were passed in to
host_manager's get_filtered_hosts().  Unfortunately that's what the unit
tests tested, but the real caller (filter_scheduler) actually passes a
list of HostState class instances.

Unit tests are fixed to pass HostStates and the offending code in the
host_manager has been fixed.

Change-Id: I54a3385da7c095e8ddf26b7536d46a9ee4072a58
"}]
commit_message:
Make ignore_hosts and force_hosts work again

Fixes bug 1087807

A recent refactor of scheduling filters and weights broke the
ignore_hosts and force_hosts functionality.  The refactored code would
have only worked if a list of host names (strings) were passed in to
host_manager's get_filtered_hosts().  Unfortunately that's what the unit
tests tested, but the real caller (filter_scheduler) actually passes a
list of HostState class instances.

Unit tests are fixed to pass HostStates and the offending code in the
host_manager has been fixed.

Change-Id: I54a3385da7c095e8ddf26b7536d46a9ee4072a58

commit_message:
Allow remote stdlib exceptions to be deserialized

Fixes bug #1086798

Add 'exceptions' to allowed_rpc_exception_modules so that stdlib
exceptions (like NotImplementedError) can be deserialized from a
RemoteError.

Change-Id: I57f40fed2a86cc08fb64b81d648c71cd7db8027c

commit_message:
Run test objectstore server on arbitrary free port

When tests are run under a test runner that runs tests concurrently
(like testr) failures can occur when two test processes attempt to
listen on the same port. Set the test objectstore server to use an
arbitrary free port when testing to avoid this problem.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I7c5e06b10b03bf042fb86235a562ffae4762b8f1

subject: Remove print statements.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-04 19:31:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-12-04 19:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This sort of thing has come up before.  While I have no problem with removing print statements from the rest of the code, it seems to me that the print statements in the test code provide valuable debugging information, should the tests they are in happen to fail.  Is there any way to accommodate this sort of debugging output with testr?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-12-07 19:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Totally - there are actually a couple of ways...

Logging messages get captured on a per-test basis, so any thing you log will get displayed with the failing test.

Additionally, you can use self.addDetail to add named detail information to the testcase itself. This will also be printed.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-12-08 07:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

'}]

commit_message:
Make copy_to_volume a bit more useful.

The current implementation of cinder.driver.copy_to_volume
does not take in to account image type and is only valid
for raw images.  This doesn't do much good for the majority
of cases, and rather than require folks to have a raw version
uploaded to Glance, let's just do a convert if needed on the fly.

This simply creates a temp file, does the conversion and then
writes the temp file directly to the volume.

Change-Id: I849b04b8aae76da068abcd2a20c1fcecca8a5caa

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 17:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'heat-db-setup read engine config file for DB connection details

Currently heat-db-setup, or rather the underlying python -m heat.db.sqlalchemy.manage
has a hard-coded database connection URL, so DB setup will fail if a non-default
configuration exists in /etc/heat/heat-engine.conf.

This attempts to read the sql_connection from the DEFAULT section of heat-engine.conf
falling back to the old default string on failure.

bug/1087741

Change-Id: Ieb41503a58ee0804d79a32a8286268803c9f456c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat-db-setup read engine config file for DB connection details

Currently heat-db-setup, or rather the underlying python -m heat.db.sqlalchemy.manage
has a hard-coded database connection URL, so DB setup will fail if a non-default
configuration exists in /etc/heat/heat-engine.conf.

This attempts to read the sql_connection from the DEFAULT section of heat-engine.conf
falling back to the old default string on failure.

bug/1087741

Change-Id: Ieb41503a58ee0804d79a32a8286268803c9f456c
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 19:17:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add a note about identical GID/UID for live migrat

fixes bug 1080680

As noted in the bug report, if the GID and UID are not identical
between the servers, live migration fails badly and requires
some cleanup. This change adds a step to ensure users are aware
this needs to be done before creating the mount.

patch 2: adds a new section to the System Administration chapter
for the proceedure to recover from a UID/GID mismatch

patch 3: clarifies that the proceedure from patch 2 is run on
nova-compute hosts

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17281/

Change-Id: Id656b2bb62a97430999fc2c7ffd93e51a804a464
'}]
commit_message:
Add a note about identical GID/UID for live migrat

fixes bug 1080680

As noted in the bug report, if the GID and UID are not identical
between the servers, live migration fails badly and requires
some cleanup. This change adds a step to ensure users are aware
this needs to be done before creating the mount.

patch 2: adds a new section to the System Administration chapter
for the proceedure to recover from a UID/GID mismatch

patch 3: clarifies that the proceedure from patch 2 is run on
nova-compute hosts

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17281/

Change-Id: Id656b2bb62a97430999fc2c7ffd93e51a804a464

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 19:23:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add minimum dnsmasq version to quantum doc

fixes bug 108277

The Quantum docs do not contain the minimum supported dnsmasq version
. The version is important as older dnsmasq releases do not support
all of the options that Quantum needs.

dnsmasq 2.59 and newer is known to work.

Patchset fixes misspelling of quantum from qantum

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17573/

Change-Id: Ied596baf1b93b77a5753de0fa9343ec1b740a2be
'}]
commit_message:
Add minimum dnsmasq version to quantum doc

fixes bug 108277

The Quantum docs do not contain the minimum supported dnsmasq version
. The version is important as older dnsmasq releases do not support
all of the options that Quantum needs.

dnsmasq 2.59 and newer is known to work.

Patchset fixes misspelling of quantum from qantum

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17573/

Change-Id: Ied596baf1b93b77a5753de0fa9343ec1b740a2be

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 19:57:37.000000000', 'message': 'clarify network inconsistencies in nova.conf

fixes bug 1061352

As in the bug report, public_interface in nova.conf was set to wrong
values and it was unclear that it should be an unconfigured physical
interface.

This patch changes the value and adds some comments and
 clarifications from the mailing lists.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17578/

Change-Id: I5a62817a0a32d85d9ead14611d63b0f1412d493b
'}]
commit_message:
clarify network inconsistencies in nova.conf

fixes bug 1061352

As in the bug report, public_interface in nova.conf was set to wrong
values and it was unclear that it should be an unconfigured physical
interface.

This patch changes the value and adds some comments and
 clarifications from the mailing lists.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17578/

Change-Id: I5a62817a0a32d85d9ead14611d63b0f1412d493b
