messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-04 22:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-merge/13432 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-docs/9152 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/14462 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-python26/10600 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-python27/10672 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21070 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17511/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/3897 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-12-04 23:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is this really needed.
Isn't the preemption done cooperatively, or at specific "greened points". I.E. global access like this are fine?'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-12-05 00:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I really think that this should be checking to see how many loop0 are available via sysfs and send out a notification saying that the number of loop0 have ran out."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-12-05 00:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@padraig -- the previous change in this chain adds retries with sleeps, which means we do need locking. I'd have to read the calling code to see if that was true anyways -- what happens when two instances are spawning at the same time? Wouldn't exec()ing helpers like iptables mean that we could be stepping over each other here?

@chuck -- that's how this code used to work, and it causes instance spawn failures under load. The loop use is only for temporary things like file injection, so running out doesn't indicate a permanent failure. Retrying is better IMHO."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-12-05 09:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

> @padraig -- the previous change in this chain adds retries with sleeps, which means we do need locking.

Oh I see. So the previous patch is incorrect as
now DEVICES.pop() can throw an IndexError.
IMHO this patch should be incorporated with the previous one, so that empty DEVICES[] is handled consistently.
I.E. ideally each patch should be correct in
isolation if at all possible.

Note I still don't see the need for the synchronised
decorations on these new functions as I don't think
different threads will run them at the same time.
Why would a greenthread be preempted when running
one of _inner_aquire() or free_nbs() ?"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-12-07 21:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

'}]

commit_message:
Record user actions taken on instances.

The goal of this is to record actions on an instance through the API,
and any errors that arise.  This will provide some insight into what has
been done to an instance, and later will provide the ability to see
errors that have occurred without requiring the VM to be in an error
state.

Blueprint instance-actions

Change-Id: I780b7d187505b2c22d6264731b184204d6c3fc93

[{'created': '2012-12-07 18:36:13.000000000', 'message': 'Better defaults that fix volume support

The default value for block_device_mapping should not be a path, rather should be the name of the actual device in /dev.  The device_path should also be defaulted to the fully qualified path to that device.  This patch fixes volume support and does not require you to set reddwarf_volume_support=False to get a guest to boot sucessfully.

fixes bug: 1084802

Change-Id: I8aa8582da7b400c91f761a2974f859df8cd45003
'}]
commit_message:
Better defaults that fix volume support

The default value for block_device_mapping should not be a path, rather should be the name of the actual device in /dev.  The device_path should also be defaulted to the fully qualified path to that device.  This patch fixes volume support and does not require you to set reddwarf_volume_support=False to get a guest to boot sucessfully.

fixes bug: 1084802

Change-Id: I8aa8582da7b400c91f761a2974f859df8cd45003

commit_message:
Don't get nested stacks by name

Don't return nested stacks from stack_get_by_name(). This prevented the
user creating a stack with the same name as a nested stack, and was a
temporary workaround for the metadata server (see
be3c066ab87cc6e1a2ca8c097eeccd9217d7329a)

bug 1072954

Change-Id: I1e3d0289476377f5b4169835119052f4fa573f86
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

We don't need quantumclient because the tests use a fake client anyway, so
don't skip the test if it is not installed.

Change-Id: I7cd2447b5a68072d2b43228ab85c53d0124496e5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-07 03:46:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove incorrect unused RHEL install doc

Remove a file that describes how to install on RHEL using Grid Dynamics.

The Grid Dynamics repo doesn't exist anymore, and this file doesn't
seem to actually be used anywhere, and we have a RHEL-based install
guide anyway, so this should be safe to delete.

Fixes bug 1085567

Change-Id: Iba33d3aca404338094d66a69ca6a9c959ee4136b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove incorrect unused RHEL install doc

Remove a file that describes how to install on RHEL using Grid Dynamics.

The Grid Dynamics repo doesn't exist anymore, and this file doesn't
seem to actually be used anywhere, and we have a RHEL-based install
guide anyway, so this should be safe to delete.

Fixes bug 1085567

Change-Id: Iba33d3aca404338094d66a69ca6a9c959ee4136b

commit_message:
Enable Quantum unit tests

We don't need quantumclient because the tests use a fake client anyway, so
don't skip the test if it is not installed.

Change-Id: Ib350dca6eb8ea27c8b1980eba15b3c9c48738d87
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-12-07 13:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'Get rid of naked except: clauses

The only time it is legitimate to catch all exceptions is when the
exception is rethrown.

Change-Id: If72243d7a2c73b42de01d2a59514ead76c20d034
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Get rid of naked except: clauses

The only time it is legitimate to catch all exceptions is when the
exception is rethrown.

Change-Id: If72243d7a2c73b42de01d2a59514ead76c20d034
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat : Clarify openstack versions for Fedora releases

Update getting started to clarify which versions of openstack are
expected to work with each Fedora version - I tested F18 alpha and
things worked OK, so now F18 is beta things should work on F18, and
I've been running F17+folsom preview for quite a while with no problem

Change-Id: I0610e69ec22ca399cec21bc67f72dc10cb6c4597
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make the standard devstack logging work with XenServer

Fixes bug 1087387

Stop redirecting the output in devstack to ensure when
you configure LOGFILE that the devstack scripts keep working

Change-Id: I00dce315f5f79c4fc351d9ab11c504274d998fce

commit_message:
Add the ability to filter on metadata.

So the syntax would be like this:
/resources/<resource>/meters/<meter>?metadata.image=fruit&metadata.flavor=apples

It works on resources, meters and events.

This is a basic version for the v1 API, the syntax might need to be different
for the v2 API.

blueprint multi-dimensions

Change-Id: I625caa09605239e7554b9a897377a9ac457bf8ae

is an alias for --log_file. This resolves some backwards compatability

commit_message:
Add deprecated --logfile common opt.

This adds a deprecated common options for --logfile which
is an alias for --log_file. This resolves some backwards compatability
issues with the most recent oslo common code where --logfile
was no longer a valid opt.

Change-Id: I17b1277da94a2d81ae439d650a6d7321420dfe14

Ah, I didn't catch that it was stable/folsom."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-11-29 15:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-12-07 06:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Dan Prince noticed that --logfile no longer works with this patch

See I19ef3a1c00e97af64d199e27cb1cdc5c63b46a82

That's because Nova doesn't explicitly register the logfile option as a CLI, so this patch makes it not available via the CLI before

Probably a good example of how this is likely not a "safe" fix for stable/folsom'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-23 08:16:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments

Fixes bug #1082279

Only options registered using register_cli_opt() should be available via
the CLI, but since e42276a all options are added to the CLI.

Also modify one of the existing unit tests to catch this problem.

(cherry picked from commit f21e1d96)

Change-Id: I742a4ae4e0fc17cd9ae5e4424c2edd38e2bc50a2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments

Fixes bug #1082279

Only options registered using register_cli_opt() should be available via
the CLI, but since e42276a all options are added to the CLI.

Also modify one of the existing unit tests to catch this problem.

(cherry picked from commit f21e1d96)

Change-Id: I742a4ae4e0fc17cd9ae5e4424c2edd38e2bc50a2

commit_message:
Detect shared storage; handle base cleanup better.

If base image storage is shared, we need to care about remote
instances when we clean up. This patch "learns" which storage is
shared, and then decides what base images are in use anywhere
on the set of compute nodes which share that base storage.

This is complicated because shared instance storage doesn't have
to be per-cluster. It could for example be per rack. We need to
handle that properly.

This should resolve bug 1078594.

Change-Id: I36d0d6e965b114bb68c8f7b7fd43f8e96b2dd8f5

commit_message:
Remove database usage from libvirt imagecache module

This removes the database instance list operation from the libvirt
imagecache module and pushes it up into compute/manager.py.

This is a step in the proposed strategy to move db usage out of the virt
drivers up into compute/manager.py in support of bp:no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I2ea39f14304ed4b44c7ac9650703a5f780411c18

As was said previously, this looks like an optimization rather than fixing any particular high-impact user-visible issue

Perhaps it's just required for the dependent fixes for the more serious cleanup issue?

Taken together, these "image cache on shared storage cleanup" patches make a large and very risky change

Given that we have a workaround documented in http://wiki.openstack.org/ReleaseNotes/2012.2.1, I think we should at least punt until after 2012.2.1 is released this week

I'm not totally convinced it will be worth the risk after 2012.2.1 either though :('}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-28 17:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Delete type call in api needs update to use ID.

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/51a438c8f3f0d13c6779602264d72cde82feab9c
Introduced UUID's for volume_type ID and also changed delete to use ID
instead of name.

That changed neglected to update the call in contrib/types_manage,
this patch fixes that.

Fixes bug 1087161

Change-Id: I839228cd656afaf68caedfe673f9191488ccc397

[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Every devstack-gate run happens on a completely new system with almost nothing installed.  You can read about the process here:

https://github.com/openstack-ci/devstack-gate/blob/master/README.md

It's very likely that this change is the proximal cause of the failure."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks like that bug is intermittent.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

tools/configure_tempest is now a no-op in devstack, so this change should be very harmless at this point.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

devstack itself has changed since the first test, so that is also a possible reason for the difference in results.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 23:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Stop duplicating the configuration

* The ./stack.sh does the configuration first
* You can see in the logs the configuration happened twice

Change-Id: I6f7b467f64345221b9b31538c26df2181cf20a76

commit_message:
Change Exception MissingArgs's string

The error message in MissingArgs shows python names not the arg name the
user will use in the CLI (see for example 'nova-manage flavor create')

Change-Id: I544cede6ec60c8cde2438d1b378191271cec1aec

commit_message:
Allow nova and others to override some logging defaults

- In log.py, indicate that logging module allows tweaking
of just logging_context_format_string option
- In cfg.py, add a method that can alter the default given
the options and new default
- add testcases for log.set_defaults and cfg.set_defaults

Fixes LP #1083218

Change-Id: Iefdbce8505eb7a07f2b59d4ed7564b0146f1b0cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 22:38:54.000000000', 'message': 'Do not wrap exceptions during quantum resource delete

The stack should go into the DELETE_FAILED state, and a delete
is attempted on all resources regardless of failures.

Change-Id: Ib707c8112d9053a8627c733f4323f514d30628e9
'}]
commit_message:
Do not wrap exceptions during quantum resource delete

The stack should go into the DELETE_FAILED state, and a delete
is attempted on all resources regardless of failures.

Change-Id: Ib707c8112d9053a8627c733f4323f514d30628e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 21:23:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bugs in test_migrations.py

This fixes two related issues in nova/tests/test_migrations.py.

First, the snake_walk flag was only set to True for the first test run
out of TestMigrations. setUp() always set snake_walk to False initially
then would only update the value if TEST_DATABASES was empty.
TEST_DATABASES was only empty during the setUp() of the first test.
Fix this by resetting test_databases before each test.

Second, because snake_walk was always False when test_walk_versions
performing the snake walk version of the database migrations was never
tested and broken. When downgrading from version X to version X -1 of a
database version X must be passed to the migration tool as version X
contains the downgrade path for that particular version. Set the correct
versions when snake walking the DB migrations.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I8d4d9ee8efe46b4690dd6cbe95879e88aaeb0b5a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bugs in test_migrations.py

This fixes two related issues in nova/tests/test_migrations.py.

First, the snake_walk flag was only set to True for the first test run
out of TestMigrations. setUp() always set snake_walk to False initially
then would only update the value if TEST_DATABASES was empty.
TEST_DATABASES was only empty during the setUp() of the first test.
Fix this by resetting test_databases before each test.

Second, because snake_walk was always False when test_walk_versions
performing the snake walk version of the database migrations was never
tested and broken. When downgrading from version X to version X -1 of a
database version X must be passed to the migration tool as version X
contains the downgrade path for that particular version. Set the correct
versions when snake walking the DB migrations.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I8d4d9ee8efe46b4690dd6cbe95879e88aaeb0b5a

[{'created': '2012-12-06 20:39:49.000000000', 'message': 'early failures would prevent cleanup

because we are using finally: to do cleanup, we are cleaning
up variables which may never have been allocated, thus throwing
and additional exception and leaving state around after our
shutdown.

Discovered by bug #1087298 however this is not a fix for that
bug

Change-Id: I395301e619cc290367aa0ab8fb02d729343f1432
'}]
commit_message:
early failures would prevent cleanup

because we are using finally: to do cleanup, we are cleaning
up variables which may never have been allocated, thus throwing
and additional exception and leaving state around after our
shutdown.

Discovered by bug #1087298 however this is not a fix for that
bug

Change-Id: I395301e619cc290367aa0ab8fb02d729343f1432

commit_message:
Fix XenAPINFS configuration

fixes bug 1087272

Trying to configure XenAPINFS volume driver through localrc options
failed. This fix removes the extra check, as lib/cinder already exits on
error.

Change-Id: I874b7cee44861244cb7a340cc4094ef3f8b48a5a

commit_message:
Traceback when user doesn't have permission.

When a user tries to access an image that is
forbidden it sends an HTTPForbidden. Inform the user
with a help message that the permission is not available
to them.

Change-Id: I89011ade1fa9494e5e0ad0a3814752cf639576f2

commit_message:
Move grub installation to the vm element

It makes more sense for grub to be installed by the vm element, since
that is intended to produce directly bootable disk images.

Change-Id: Ic340ba9d3ec4dbeea3aed3576fc899c1424783a2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-06 19:34:18.000000000', 'message': 'Pass string to template_format.parse()

Since template_format.parse() attempts to guess the type of the input
instead of using yaml.parse for everything, the input must be a string and
not a stream, even though yaml.parse() can handle either.

Change-Id: I07dc13a54492f3f6db17bfca3cc9e129c765eed5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Pass string to template_format.parse()

Since template_format.parse() attempts to guess the type of the input
instead of using yaml.parse for everything, the input must be a string and
not a stream, even though yaml.parse() can handle either.

Change-Id: I07dc13a54492f3f6db17bfca3cc9e129c765eed5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow exceptions to pass over RPC silently

When one service performs an operation on behalf of another, the
act of passing back an exception (even a known one) causes a lot
of scary log messages about the (presumed to be) error case. This
patch adds a client_exceptions decorator common/rpc/common.py,
which allows RPC services to declare the list of expected exceptions
for each method. If such an exception is raised during the RPC
dispatch, it is wrapped in a ClientException so that the RPC layer
can gracefully pass it back without overly-verbose logging.

This will allow us to fix nova bug 1084707

Change-Id: I4e7b19dc730342091fd70a717065741d56da4555

to install swift3. This patch adds a note.

Rebase against master, update revision history.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-03 20:24:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594

commit_message:
Fix minidns delete_entry to work for hostname with mixed case chars

Fix commonly used methods like parse_line and qualify to return
lower case strings. Review incoming method arguments to make sure
we are using comparisons where both strings are in lower case.
Fix a few spots where the input parameters were not in lower case
Added a test case for a specific problem that showed up in
the devstack gate job.

Change-Id: Ia204bde26cee5a1b22e8240a5310c5d45ffafb32

any idea why this was in here in the first place?'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-05 19:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I did not have. Thats why I sent it first alone.

It also caused me issues when asked for password.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-05 19:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

BASE_SQL_CONN related for db_uri


get_db_handle_and_meta using it in tempest/whitebox.py'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-05 20:45:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I will keep this. It has other usage, but for other reason not tested.
Now I remember, I partially traced it several days before.

I want to move the tempest configs to lib/tempest and configure similar to other services, based on the tempest.conf.sample.

I do not see why we need multiple timeout variable for the same value.

I do not see why we need CATALOG_TYPE -s here.

I will remove the BOTO_AWS_ACCESS, BOTO_AWS_SECRET, BOTO_AWS_REGION too.

Am I need to split it to multiple commits ?


After that I'll solve the image providing, for boto tests. (UEC case only)"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2012-12-05 20:48:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is needed for postgres support in the script. Try running this script after starting devstack with 'use_database postgres' in your localrc and you will see the need for at least 2 of these lines. 

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15581/"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2012-12-05 21:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I will move the BASE_SQL_CONN to the stack.sh or create dedicated function for calculating it...

names.

commit_message:
Name the tgt/conf.d enties based on the vg name

On one system multiple volume and volume manger could be installed and
needs dedicated tgt config entries.
cinder-volumes, stack-volumes, nova-volumes are the default volume group
names.
/etc/tgt/conf.d/ files should be named based on the volume-group name.
The vg name is uniq on one system.
In devstack case the stack.conf is usable.

Changes:
* Rename conf.d/cinder.conf to conf.d/stack.conf
* Handle conf.d similary on all distribution

Change-Id: I856cdf4a21a414d2940d8f9d8b0b0368b1fad887

* Mark the glance is able to work with newer boto libraries

Change-Id: Iff484f1e40fe103879ff11a611c0691486288be6
'}, {'created': '2012-12-01 21:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow newer boto versions

In the past an automated build system tried to pip install a boto
version, which wasn't able to build.
Nowadays this issue not exists.

Change-Id: Iff484f1e40fe103879ff11a611c0691486288be6
"}, {'created': '2012-12-05 14:48:57.000000000', 'message': "Allow newer boto library versions

Change the boto dependency specification in pip-requires to just 'boto'
without version restriction, as it was before the build issue.

Change-Id: Iff484f1e40fe103879ff11a611c0691486288be6
"}]
commit_message:
Allow newer boto library versions

Change the boto dependency specification in pip-requires to just 'boto'
without version restriction, as it was before the build issue.

Change-Id: Iff484f1e40fe103879ff11a611c0691486288be6

* With pep8 1.3.3 the exclude logic monkey patch broke causing
  tools/hacking to run on openstack/common code
* Also add .git to exclude list

Fix bug 1086410

Change-Id: Ifc50ac1963c50c338432bbb4b1e15cdf58ed2128
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 exclude logic for 1.3.3

* With pep8 1.3.3 the exclude logic monkey patch broke causing
  tools/hacking to run on openstack/common code
* Also add .git to exclude list

Fix bug 1086410

Change-Id: Ifc50ac1963c50c338432bbb4b1e15cdf58ed2128

commit_message:
Make parameter list generation consistent using urlencode().

Ensure that each client is generating the parameter list
correctly by using the urllib.urlencode method.

Fixes: bug 1086574
Change-Id: I9008a57fe94ccec1f3bea95f314860ff8017cb42

commit_message:
Empty Body testing according to the RFC2616

* 204, 205, 304 response MUST NOT have a body
* 205 MUST NOT have entity-header
* responses to a HEAD method MUST NOT have a body
* responses with 1xx codes MUST NOT have a body

Change-Id: I24f60459141e6273c03f146352f583669e16ee23

commit_message:
Clarify memcache vs swift config error

fixes bug 1034144

proxy-server.conf has a higher priority
if it memcache_servers is set there, so fix the doc to state this

Minor fixes and update to revision history in book file.

Change-Id: I509aa7249c460d7da499a446e31763cc8ed5b5cf

subject: Remove leftover references to files/pips/
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-29 08:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17110/1/check/gate-devstack-merge/1819 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17110/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/20415 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-11-29 19:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2012-12-03 04:00:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd to use the files/pips mechanism to add the extras library, which is:
- too new to be packaged anywhere
- now required by oslo-incubator, and thus all open stack projects which use service.py

http://pypi.python.org/pypi/extras/0.0.1
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16789/

Also, it seems that doing a sudo pip install on every project's tools/pip-requires might end up in a bit of a mess?"}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-03 07:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Steve: the fact is that we already do the "sudo pip install" trick for the requires of each openstack components. So the extras module will get installed that way.

Now, if the question is "should we really do that 'sudo pip install' thing?", that's a different topic. It's easier to not update devstack and to rely on the requires in each components, imho.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2012-12-03 20:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Steve: the fact is that we already do the "sudo pip install" trick for the requires of each openstack components. So the extras module will get installed that way.

Could you point to where this happens? I expected extras to get installed from heat/tools/pip-requires but it wasn't.'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-04 08:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Steve: in configure_heat(), there's a call to "setup_develop $HEAT_DIR". This should be pip-installing the requirements. If it's not the case here, then I guess "python setup.py egg_info" doesn't generate what you need for some reason.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2012-12-04 22:44:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for your help Vincent. I'll figure out what is going on."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 15:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-06 15:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 16:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17110/1/gate/gate-devstack-merge/2061 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17110/1/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21283 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 16:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Remove leftover references to files/pips/

The files/pips/* files were removed a while ago (replaced by
pip-requires in individual projects). So remove leftover code that was
dealing with that.

Change-Id: Id521a3365ab018193607389f022a25acddb49714

commit_message:
move setup_quantum to stack.sh

sudo is only allowed in stack.sh on the CI, so move setup_quantum code
to the stack.sh.
also fixes quantum debug command setup for linuxbridge and ryu

Change-Id: I11bc0aa242a690e25acc088b3e9f483ceab38f26

commit_message:
Start making setup.py similar to other OpenStack Projects

* Try /etc/tempest DIR if the config file not found
* Exit immediately if the config file not found
* Remove pika from dependencies
* tempest named starter script (pep8 removed run_tests.sh)

Change-Id: I1f0b1fb061a265c5f8e39627efd26decdc61ef63

commit_message:
Releasing resources of context manager functions if exceptions occur

The functions using decorator @contextlib.contextmanager in files below
has potential resorce leaks when exceptions occur.
 - quantum/tests/unit/test_policy.py
 - quantum/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py
 - quantum/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py
 - quantum/tests/unit/test_extension_security_group.py

This patch let them releasing resources correctly.

Fixes bug #1083045

Change-Id: I66266b7afa4977537caabafc82d8c294730188ba

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-12-04 10:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good on principle, but I think I would have moved this into ceilometer.collector rather than ceilometer.meter. WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-05 01:57:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think the ceilometer.collecotor is  the right place. 

Currently the collector itself is not that clear IMHO.  It is collector for all meter data from message bus, and it's also collector for all notification data which will go-through the message bus. These two collector roles have different meaning in fact.

I think we can split it into two services. One is act as an proxy to the storage, which will get meter from message bus and put into data storage. Another service is purely for notification.

The working flow is then clear, pollster/notification handler get data from other openstack project, go-through the pipeline, published to the target, the target will be collector, synaps, or log file etc."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-12-05 06:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-04 04:30:12.000000000', 'message': 'Move all meter code into seperated directory

With multiple publisher support, meter becomes only one type of
publisher, thus move all meter code into seprated directory.

Also as metering.topic and metering.secret is meter-specific information,
remove them from the publish_counter, which is assumed to be public
interface for publishers.

Change-Id: I3b4f5dac3cd46c77dc077ff6acbba79284640428
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-12-06 06:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Move meter.py into collector directory

With multiple publisher support, metering becomes only one type of
publisher, thus move the meter.py into collector.

The publish.py should be moved to publisher directory as only meter
publisher in future.

Change-Id: I3b4f5dac3cd46c77dc077ff6acbba79284640428
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move meter.py into collector directory

With multiple publisher support, metering becomes only one type of
publisher, thus move the meter.py into collector.

The publish.py should be moved to publisher directory as only meter
publisher in future.

Change-Id: I3b4f5dac3cd46c77dc077ff6acbba79284640428
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Virt inspector directly layered over hypervisor API

Addresses BP nova-independent-virt

Add the concept of a pluggable virt inspector that allows
polling of the hypervisor layer without relying on any
nova internals.

Note that the test-requires dependency on the nova master
tarball remains in place for the moment, as it's required
by the nova notifier tests.

Also we must leave the dependency on the libvirt-python
RPM or python-libvirt Debian package to the distros which
end up packaging ceilometer.

Change-Id: I20700320dd7e3196507173c780ab598b479e4021

This will add more explaination about the metadata service with l3 agent.

fix bug 1078528

Cleanup to avoid redundancy, rebase against master, removed doc bug text.

commit_message:
Drop duplicated port_id check in remove_router_interface()

Fixes bug 1075157

In addition exceptions used in remove_router_intreface are defined
and gettextized.

Change-Id: I30b1561f3d4be12e485c506e5c3828b41ab226ef

commit_message:
clarify network inconsistencies in nova.conf

fixes bug 1061352

As in the bug report, public_interface in nova.conf was set to wrong
values and it was unclear that it should be an unconfigured physical
interface.

This patch changes the value and adds some comments and
 clarifications from the mailing lists.

Change-Id: I13f087fca43d107ce20e31204132c6cd29e1bfb9

commit_message:
Quantum keystone page cleanup

fixes bug 1083311

multi-line commands are indented when they should not be - fixed

the example of adding the admin role below is unclear, as as it uses UUIDs without indicating where
it got those uuids - replaced with more commands

. The version is important as older dnsmasq releases do not support

commit_message:
Add minimum dnsmasq version to quantum doc

fixes bug 108277

The Quantum docs do not contain the minimum supported dnsmasq version
. The version is important as older dnsmasq releases do not support
all of the options that Quantum needs.

dnsmasq 2.59 and newer is known to work.

Patchset fixes misspelling of quantum from qantum

Change-Id: I83f0bcecf2c120475d375baa0ce9c58f9ceb9676

commit_message:
Fix small errors with several documents

fixes bug 1087067

As in the bug report, there are three issues with these documents:

1. one liner for glance
2. use raw links to the scripts on github
3. there is no novnc service to restart

which this patch fixes

Change-Id: I8366cfc1f0f044fdcc79670960e04be6996340db

arguments are passed in.

Fixes bug 1083315

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-06 01:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-12-06 11:25:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

My 2c: I don't really see the point in hacking parsed_template() to do something other than what it says on the tin just to reuse 1 line of code from it. You could just do:

  self.stack.resolve_runtime_data(self.t) == self.stack.resolve_runtime_data(other.t)

In fact, while I'm a fan of using the builtin operators where it makes sense, I'm not sure this logic belongs in Resource.__eq__ at all, since it's very specific to the update logic. It seems like it would be better to make this explicit in Stack.update(). Replace:

  if self[res.name] != res:

with:

  if self.resolve_runtime_data(self[res.name].t) != self.resolve_runtime_data(res.t):

and all the hackery goes away to be replaced with a 1-line change that tells you exactly what is being compared."}]

[{'created': '2012-12-05 23:01:10.000000000', 'message': 'Resource.__eq__ allow resources in different stacks

Doing a stack update was incorrectly replacing identical resources
because Refs in the new resource were evaluating to None in the new stack.

This change temporarily makes the two resources believe they are in the same
stack, so runtime data resolves for the other resource.

Change-Id: I7e09ee1238dd01490cdfe186c51b7fada9546a63
'}, {'created': '2012-12-06 00:59:16.000000000', 'message': 'Resource.__eq__ allow resources in different stacks

Doing a stack update was incorrectly replacing identical resources
because Refs in the new resource were evaluating to None in the new stack.

This change allows an alternative template to be passed to parsed_template
and modifies __eq__ to compare the two templates in the same stack.

__eq__ now also checks that the name of both resources matches, since a stack
could have multiple identical resources with different names.

Change-Id: I7e09ee1238dd01490cdfe186c51b7fada9546a63

commit_message:
Resource.__eq__ allow resources in different stacks

Doing a stack update was incorrectly replacing identical resources
because Refs in the new resource were evaluating to None in the new stack.

This change allows an alternative template to be passed to parsed_template
and modifies __eq__ to compare the two templates in the same stack.

__eq__ now also checks that the name of both resources matches, since a stack
could have multiple identical resources with different names.

Change-Id: I7e09ee1238dd01490cdfe186c51b7fada9546a63

commit_message:
powervm: Refactored run_command for better naming

This change refactors two methods of blockdev.py in the
interest of better naming. run_command() and run_command_as_root()
have been refactored as run_vios_command() and
run_vios_command_as_root() respectively to better indicate that these
run commands on a remote system, the VIOS.

bp powervm-compute-enhancements

Change-Id: If65b4ff08e058443c7d10fcdf98e13c7aa207c56

commit_message:
Configure git proxy settings and prefer http(s) protocol

Set a proxy for http protocol usage by git, and switch to using
the https:// protocol in preference to git:// to make it easier
to clone from behind firewalls.

Change-Id: I41e809c54f3065d59ca84d83be80b9472361dd9d

Excellent feature! I have a few questions though, here and inline.

In the Subject Alternate Name extension handling, is it enough to only accept DNS:<hostname> ? I'm not very familiar with x509, but from my reading of it we might also want to support URI and dirName.

I'm happy to take those as separate bugs or merge proposals, however.'

Hi Mark,

Thanks for your review -- a belated reply.

> is it enough to only accept DNS:<hostname> ?

So I think that covers most standard cases, and its obviously secure in that a URI/whatever cert would be wrongly rejected rather than accepted.

What the patch also doesn't have is ASN.1 support -- there could be other corner cases there.

I too am happy to see how this goes and add functionality as it becomes required."}]

commit_message:
Verify that host matches certificate

When using https verify that the Common Name (CN) or
the Subject Alternative Name listed in the server's
certificate match the host we are connected to.

Addresses LP bug 1079692.

Change-Id: I24ea1511a2cbdb7c34ce72ac704d7b5e7d57cec2

Sync latest openstack.common.rpc

Changes since last sync:

 202f568 Use json instead of jsonutils in rpc.impl_fake.
 6d102bc Provide i18n to those messages without _()
 8695285 Qpid H/A cluster support
 faeafe1 Fixes import order
 cf705c5 Make project pyflakes clean.
 05f8ec7 Fix common rpc to use common logging instead of python logging
 b6d24bb updating sphinx documentation
 33fbd87 Added initialize_service_hook for rpc.Service.
 cf849e0 Clean up dictionary use in RPC drivers

Change-Id: I4fbade51390e159bd9cccd2afc918a4f07740993

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-05 08:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17527/1/check/gate-devstack-merge/2013 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17527/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21103 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2012-12-05 09:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The code seems OK to me, but I have a different thought about when and how to check the service status. Feel free to ignore me.

Instead of checking the all the service status at the very end, I think maybe we should check the every single service status in the function screen_it(). As soon as it detects a service not running correctly, it should stops/exit by default and tells the users of the failure.

Besides, instead of struggling with the pid/ppid, would it be simple to change command being sent to a screen window in function screen_it() as something like:

   screen -S $SCREEN_NAME -p $1 -X stuff "rm -f $1.failure && $2 || touch $1.failure$NL"

and check the existence of the file $1.failure for failure?'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-12-05 17:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I agree with Lianhao Lu about stopping devstack as soon as there's a failure. It has actually been useful to me to have devstack go on, so I could then later fix the small issue and manually start the service, without having to call ./stack.sh again.

I agree that having to deal with the pid/ppid like that is a bit painful, though. Having some other way to implement this might be good.

Oh, and outputting "Service foo is working well" is not that useful; better to just tell when there's an error, to make it the errors easier to spot.'}, {'account_id': 4634, 'date': '2012-12-06 08:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Abandon the patch. Will cook a new one for service check.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-05 06:29:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add a screen_check function

There is no function to check if the services invoked by screen are
running well or not. We could use the function to check the status
of processes running within screen and print them.

Change-Id: Ia7cb641c11a3cdab3af799ffee4938d0cdda1865
'}]
commit_message:
Add a screen_check function

There is no function to check if the services invoked by screen are
running well or not. We could use the function to check the status
of processes running within screen and print them.

Change-Id: Ia7cb641c11a3cdab3af799ffee4938d0cdda1865

commit_message:
Adds fix for correct handling of query params

* Fix conversion of dictionary params to query params.
* Use standard lib module urllib to do so.
* Reorganizing imports.

Fixes LP Bug #1086677

Change-Id: I96fbbd08de7b35c483c6bdbb7dbe5c8b9a185d61

commit_message:
Support for collecting rabbitmq logs

we are collecting logs for kern/syslog etc, should do the same for rabbitmq
as well. Trying to diagnose 1079687 and suspecting we may see something
in rabbitmq's logs. Make sure all the collected files are visible in the
browser.

Change-Id: Ia962cabebbdf3b9a3f6007795457f4e6e24c4766

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-03 10:20:32.000000000', 'message': "Don't add trailing slash to auth URL.

Adding a trailing slash to the authentication URL may interfere with
auth service implementations not using /FOO/ but /FOO as authentication
URL.

OpenStack Object Storage API 1.0 doesn't specify that the auth URL must
end in a slash and swiftclient.client doesn't force it either.

Change-Id: I4e6b6d758d5ccc884e253880513e3d8763ffc2ff
Fixes: bug #1085827
"}]
commit_message:
Don't add trailing slash to auth URL.

Adding a trailing slash to the authentication URL may interfere with
auth service implementations not using /FOO/ but /FOO as authentication
URL.

OpenStack Object Storage API 1.0 doesn't specify that the auth URL must
end in a slash and swiftclient.client doesn't force it either.

Change-Id: I4e6b6d758d5ccc884e253880513e3d8763ffc2ff
Fixes: bug #1085827

commit_message:
Test Case to check "copy object across container"

Adds a test case to "test_object_services.py" so as to check successful
copy of objects across containers. Also renamed existing 'copy_object'
method in object_client.py to 'copy_object_in_same_container' so as to
be more specific about the action that method does. Hence modified
test cases that earlier used 'copy_object' method  to use
'copy_object_in_same_container' method.

Change-Id: I3182122d115586a4027b92b92a34eaaeba4dc2db
Implements: blueprint add-some-functional-swift-tests

commit_message:
Fix qpid cast_to_server regression.

This patches addresses a regression in the qpid driver for the
cast_to_server and fanout_cast_to_server methods.  The regression was
introduced in 86952852c1dadd54f1294ae0adba01cfe827b8ce.

There are test cases that cover this code, but unfortunately they are
not being run by jenkins because python-qpid is not available in pypi.

Fix bug 1086848.

Change-Id: I89d4f81149f9a05c578b5ec544c5e34311484c6c

commit_message:
Consolidate calls to transfer_headers()

Further refactoring to consolidate calls to transfer_headers() now that we
have a helper method for constructing them.

Change-Id: I5953721a342eadb4061478401d6bca259c56ea16
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-12-05 22:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I did not think about 424 as I interpreted the dependency as a sub-request specified in the body of this request.

Actually RFC 4918 refers to "actions", without stating that they should be explicitly specified in a request. We can also say that a port creation implies an IP allocation action in most cases.

I'm ok with 424, then.

Something to keep in mind is that both 422 and 424 are extension codes (Webdav I think). If we want to comply with strict HTTP/1.1 error codes we should probably choose 400.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-12-05 22:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Rename flavour to element.

Flavour is overloaded in openstack due to it being used by nova. Element
seems to have the same feeling of combinability without using a term already
in active use in the openstack community.

Change-Id: Ia4c028d4062a8f69c66665821c94dd4bcdf06031

commit_message:
Return a better error message(security_groups)

When creating a security group, whose name contains
other chars than numbers and letters, a non supportive error
message is thrown.

Fixes bug 1085888

Change-Id: I58ab57be29c0935dbfd10831fbaf97d09f654781

subject: Bug 1075090 -- Fixing log messages in python source code to support internationalization.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3108, 'date': '2012-11-21 08:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Thanks for doing this and adding me as the reviewer. 
I have two comments: 
(1) We'd better not to translate debug messages. So we don't need to wrap those messages with _().
(2) If a message has two placeholders, we need to pay attention to error "Multiple positional placeholders".'}, {'account_id': 5971, 'date': '2012-12-05 00:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5971, 'date': '2012-12-05 01:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2012-12-05 06:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-12-05 16:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

just ran a recheck.  For some reason, no Jenkins run.  But I expect it to work if smokestack worked.

Dumb question,  was any of the translation stuff actually tested? We should be able to test it.  In the past, I  made sure that at least one other language worked for a smattering of points. I like testing with Chinese, Hebrew, Russian, and English.  If those 4 work, it works.  Translations were done via translate.google.com, and were replaced by real translations afterwards. 

The keys for translation can be done by hand, it is just preferable to get them into transifex.

If, for example, you wanted to test with Chinese, you can  create a filekeystone/locale/zh/LC_MESSAGES/keystone.po
with a smattering of the keys defined in Chinese, and then set the system locale to zh_.  Or you can add to some of the Japanese translations in ./keystone/locale/ja/LC_MESSAGES/keystone.po'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-05 16:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix broken --version command

The code for lazy loading of version string was broken. The way it
breaks in glance and oslo is different. This patch is just for oslo.
Here we end up overriding more methods in our lazy string class to make
argparse happy and added test cases to make sure we don't break again.
we also sure we cache the result of the lookup so we return the same
version everytime and for performance. Added a few test cases as well.

Fixes LP #1085984

Change-Id: I0635899c37fa8e5a7edf282907d2a5e04aa064cb

commit_message:
Allow nova and others to override some logging defaults

- In log.py, indicate that logging module allows tweaking
  of just logging_context_format_string option
- In cfg.py, add a method that can alter the default given
  the options and new default

Fixes LP #1083218

Change-Id: I839f6fe2684b8b2c88454b965270f286f87908d3

commit_message:
Only 'import *' from 'core' modules

- Renamed identity.controllers.* and identity.routers.* since they
  now occopy unique namespaces (thanks ayoung!)
- Moved catalog and policy controllers into their own respective modules

Change-Id: Ib9e277355e0eac15d4d218785c816b718b493b5b

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-12-05 14:11:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Adam: I don't understand your comment. I'm not advocating changing the location of the certificates, quite the contrary.

Running the test_create_certs works if it is run independently, i.e.

run_tests.sh -N test_cert_setup will have a correct CONF.signing.certfile in the test_create_certs test case:  /opt/stack/keystone/tests/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem

But try running the current tests together with other tests and it becomes clear that something is wrong:

run_tests.sh -N test_cert_setup test_wsgi

CONF.signing.certfile is now:
/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem

And the test fails with the OSError from the commit message.


Dolph: I created the bug now. I appreciate the effort in trying to write my name correctly :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-05 14:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
use keystone test and change config during setUp

Also fixes this traceback which I keep getting on devstack:

ERROR: test_create_certs (tests.test_cert_setup.CertSetupTestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/stack/keystone/tests/test_cert_setup.py", line 52, in tearDown
    shutil.rmtree(rootdir(SSLDIR))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 237, in rmtree
    onerror(os.listdir, path, sys.exc_info())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 235, in rmtree
    names = os.listdir(path)
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/opt/stack/keystone/tests/ssl/'

Fixes bug 1086812

Change-Id: Iba10822aaf1284549d610bb1172df03ffc48f363

commit_message:
Added documentation for the external auth support

This covers given authentication using REMOTE_USER and also the way to
implement custom auth with WSGI middleware.

DocImpact
blueprint: pluggable-identity-authentication-handlers
Change-Id: Idbac8c38d1f0be1febbbc8056c929bada6bbb07e

Ok. I'll wait for the rebase then."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-11-09 02:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

It's flowing in right now - I've updated a lot of the docstrings, there's a new thing on the client call "auth_ref" that you can take, cache, and later re-initialize the client to reassert a previous token (its basically the whole of a raw token with some helper methods around it).

There's also a shift for the authentication away from the v2.tokens.authenticate() call (although I left it in and made sure it worked as before for compatibility with Horizon).

Review at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14730/'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-11-09 12:14:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's also an env variable, OS_NO_CACHE, that is intended to disable keyring -- should utilize that here, I think"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2012-11-09 19:45:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (7 inline comments)

Dolph, please see my comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2012-11-11 05:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-11 06:01:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Something is clearly not passing muster with the tests - running devstack with this branch checked out is likely the easiest way to hunt that down.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-11-16 23:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

figured out why this is failing devstack - 

devstack (when using keystoneclient) isn't passing any flags or environment variables to disable the keyring usage, and this patch makes using keyring a default. That hangs up the devstack pending user input that the system isn't expecting.

Two options - 
1a) make sure this patch supports an ENV VAR override for disabling keyring
1b) make sure devstack is updated to set that ENV VAR 

2) make using the keyring optional and default to not using it so that it works with devstack totally as is."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-11-19 16:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

To build on what Joe said.  Do this as three changes,  this one, one for devstack, and an additional keystoneclient change.

1.  Change the defaults so they mirror current Master behavior in this patch
2.  Modify devstack to explicitly use keyring.
3.  Modify keystone to enable keyring by default.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 16:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: No score

commit_message:
bug-1040361: use keyring to store tokens

User can optionally turn off keyring by specifying the --no-cache option.
It can also be disabled with environment variable OS-NO-CACHE.

Change-Id: I8935260bf7fd6befa14798da9b4d02c81e65c417

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-29 20:06:03.000000000', 'message': 'Remove volume/gigabytes quotas/quota_classes.

Volume support has been removed in Nova Grizzly. As such we
no longer need the volumes/gigabytes quotas in Novaclient.

Fixes LP Bug #1084677.

Change-Id: I0f49b6fbc9c70ca9d7c2df190ba3a61275f9b5b4
'}, {'created': '2012-12-04 15:02:57.000000000', 'message': "Add deprecation help notes for volumes quotas.

Volume support has been removed in Grizzly. Update the help messages
on the quota_update functions so that 'volumes' and 'gigabytes'
are listed as deprecated.

Fixes LP Bug# 1084677.

Change-Id: I0f49b6fbc9c70ca9d7c2df190ba3a61275f9b5b4
"}]
commit_message:
Add deprecation help notes for volumes quotas.

Volume support has been removed in Grizzly. Update the help messages
on the quota_update functions so that 'volumes' and 'gigabytes'
are listed as deprecated.

Fixes LP Bug# 1084677.

Change-Id: I0f49b6fbc9c70ca9d7c2df190ba3a61275f9b5b4

because it blocked other issues (https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1083018), I really think that we need to prioritize getting the tests into a readable serializer (json or something instead of gzipped pickle files).

I'd really like to see that as the next hyperv patch before new features get merged, as it makes the current hyperv code something the rest of the team can't fix if issues come up that require interface changes."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-11-28 22:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Sean,

The "bug" you are referring to has nothing to do with the Hyper-V testing infrastructure, as you can see in the related commit: 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17090/

The stub files need to be updated only in case of changes on the implementation of the Hyper-V driver internals, not in case of changes of the driver's interface.

Beside that, I firmly agree (as already stated in the tests README.rst) that we need to change the format of the serialized stubs from pickle to json or another manually editable format, but I don't see it as such a problematic issue for the Nova project to require the stop of any commit on the driver's code.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-28 23:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Install qemu on openSUSE

qemu is used as a fallback when kvm cannot be used.

On Debian and Fedora, the binaries are there when kvm is installed, but
this is not the case on openSUSE.

Change-Id: I96592d105428acde9636608002109c166ac7a56a

commit_message:
Add is_ubuntu function

This replaces all of the [[ "$os_PACKAGE" = "deb" ]] tests, except when
those tests are before straight calls to dpkg.

Change-Id: I8a3ebf1b1bc5a55d736f9258d5ba1d24dabf04ea

[{'created': '2012-12-04 09:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the default for APACHE_GROUP

It should be the group of the effective apache user.

For example, on openSUSE, we use wwwrun:www for apache and $USER:users
for users.

Change-Id: I8e12a8d90d45cfd18e67a41cf5462216ae404733
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the default for APACHE_GROUP

It should be the group of the effective apache user.

For example, on openSUSE, we use wwwrun:www for apache and $USER:users
for users.

Change-Id: I8e12a8d90d45cfd18e67a41cf5462216ae404733

commit_message:
Convert volume_type id from int to uuid.

This converts the volume_type id from int to uuid.  In
addition, this also corrects an issue of deleting volume_types
by name.  Even though the client/api is taking the id, it was
converting to the name of the volume_type for the db access.

We also want to continue enforcing that the name is unique on creation
so as to avoid any confusion and for clarity in Horizon.  The api
has also been enhanced to allow you to specify the type by name
or by uuid.

This does NOT modify the things like the volume details display field
(currently shows the type 'name' not 'uuid'), these types of changes
will go in to V2 of the API.

Implements blueprint vol-type-to-uuid

Change-Id: I1c54ff2a1e0c5df5891408fc11b15176db4028c3

Thanks to Dan smith for giving me many help about what is agent? When I document it, I find much information about agent on wiki. I think it is enough. Maybe I just need explain it as a comment.

what is agent?
  The agent it's talking about is a "guest agent" which is a piece of software that runs inside the guest. The host can use this for things like accessing files on the disk, configuring networking, or running other applications/scripts in the guest while it is running. Typically this uses some hypervisor-specific transport to avoid being dependent on a working network configuration. Xen, VMware, and VirtualBox have guest agents, although the Xen driver is the only one with an implementation for managing them in openstack. KVM doesn't really have a concept of a guest agent (although one could be written).

Why need this patch update agent?
You can find the design in this link:http://wiki.openstack.org/AgentUpdate. And you can find the code in nova.virt.xenapi.vmops.VMOps._boot_new_instance.

You can find more information about the design of the GuestAgent in the following link:
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgent
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgentXenStoreCommunication'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2012-12-03 07:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2012-12-03 07:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-03 08:21:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Doesn't seem to work

The agent is talking about gust agent.The host can use this for
things like accessing files on the disk, configuring networking,
or running other applications/scripts in the guest while it is
running. Typically this uses some hypervisor-specific transport
to avoid being dependent on a working network configuration.
Xen, VMware, and VirtualBox have guest agents,although the Xen
driver is the only one with an implementation for managing them
in openstack. KVM doesn't really have a concept of a guest agent
(although one could be written).

You can find the design of agent update in this link:
http://wiki.openstack.org/AgentUpdate
and find the code in nova.virt.xenapi.vmops.VMOps._boot_new_instance.
In this design We need update agent in guest from host, so we need
some interfaces to update the agent info in host.

You can find more information about the design of the GuestAgent in
the following link:
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgent
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgentXenStoreCommunication

Change-Id: I5830388a894efce5b13680fc6916e0cd81a16624

commit_message:
Add agent build API support for list/create/delete/modify agent build

This adds an extension that provides REST API for list/create/delete/
modify agent build. The interface is accessed via

GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-agents
PUT /v2/{tenant_id}/os-agents/id
POST /v2/{tenant_id}/os-agents
DELETE /v2/{tenant_id}/os-agents

And this patch also create tests to get agent build API Samples.
DocImpact
Implements one workitem of blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

The agent is talking about guest agent.The host can use this for
things like accessing files on the disk, configuring networking,
or running other applications/scripts in the guest while it is
running. Typically this uses some hypervisor-specific transport
to avoid being dependent on a working network configuration.
Xen, VMware, and VirtualBox have guest agents,although the Xen
driver is the only one with an implementation for managing them
in openstack. KVM doesn't really have a concept of a guest agent
(although one could be written).

You can find the design of agent update in this link:
http://wiki.openstack.org/AgentUpdate
and find the code in nova.virt.xenapi.vmops.VMOps._boot_new_instance.
In this design We need update agent in guest from host, so we need
some interfaces to update the agent info in host.

You can find more information about the design of the GuestAgent in
the following link:
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgent
http://wiki.openstack.org/GuestAgentXenStoreCommunication

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5830388a894efce5b13680fc6916e0cd81a16624

messages:

Why do we need to set it now? We have run quantum a long time without it."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-12-04 00:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-04 00:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Yong

I updated the explanation'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-12-04 00:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-04 00:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-04 01:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Nachi: Mark and I were talking about how to best deal with this problem, and a better solution that came of our discussion was to ensure that the durability setting of all users of the notification queue is set in one place in devstack.  This ensures consistency during the initial install, and makes it harder for a single project configuration change to break other projects.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-12-04 09:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Mark, Gary

I agree.
The code gary mentioned looks returns always True, I just added one Env here.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/17424/4/check/gate-devstack-merge/1990 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/17424/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/21038 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-04 18:50:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Set rabbit_durable_queues=True for quantum

Fixes bug 1086167
Nova looks using durable queue now. Quantum and Nova shares
same notification queue, so Quantum should use same configration with Glance.
Note, You need to clean all rabbitmq queue after this patch.

Change-Id: Ibe20698b117898bfc6859565be6eabc42139b886

commit_message:
Add host to get_backdoor_port() for network api.

get_backdoor_port() in the network api doesn't have
a host parameter. However, if there are more than one
network service running on multiple hosts then you will
only be able to get the backdoor port for one of those
services. So the host field is needed to target the rpc
call.

Also, the RPC_API_VERSION number was incremented because this was
overlooked in change id: I95fdb5ca9bce9f3128300e3b5601fb2b2fc5e82f

Change-Id: I90357548c0483559982469b7c26d40511755924e

commit_message:
Add a note about identical GID/UID for live migrat

fixes bug 1080680

As noted in the bug report, if the GID and UID are not identical
between the servers, live migration fails badly and requires
some cleanup. This change adds a step to ensure users are aware
this needs to be done before creating the mount.

patch 2: adds a new section to the System Administration chapter
for the proceedure to recover from a UID/GID mismatch

patch 3: clarifies that the proceedure from patch 2 is run on
nova-compute hosts

Change-Id: Ie91072554ffa1ed9c2954fd58eea49303edecef5

commit_message:
Add VIF binding extensions

The is part of the blueprint vif-plugging-improvements.

The patch adds an extension to Quantum that enables the plugin to
return VIF details.

At the moment it supports openvswitch and linuxbridge.

Change-Id: Ib9b4d34e668e2ddc61c152c2c4cd4a01f2d0de40

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-02 04:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'FlatDHCPManager: Pass admin cxtx to update_dhcp.

Updates the Nova FlatDHCPManager so it passes an admin
context to update_dhcp. In some cases (linux_net) the
network driver may make use of DB calls which require an
admin context.

This fixes an issue where resize operations (confirm, revert)
would fail if the user was not an admin.

This is more fallout from 14e2ed3 where we stopped passing admin
contexts for resize across RPC.

Fixes LP Bug #1085071
Change-Id: I718c40f0df0b2955626033cf3b6f78323527e9cf

commit_message:
network managers: Pass elevated cxtx to update_dhcp

Updates the Nova FlatDHCPManager and VlanManager network
managers so they pass an elevated context to update_dhcp.
In some cases (linux_net) the network driver may make use of
DB calls which require an admin context.

This fixes an issue where resize operations (confirm, revert)
would fail if the user was not an admin.

This is more fallout from 14e2ed3 where we stopped passing admin
contexts for resize across RPC.

Fixes LP Bug #1085071
Change-Id: I718c40f0df0b2955626033cf3b6f78323527e9cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-04 17:21:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix importing of quantum resources subpackage

Apparently pkgutil.walk_packages(path) will return packages outside the
given path if they have the same names as the ones inside - so having a
quantum subpackage results in importing the global quantum package from
Quantum itself instead. Fix this by passing a package prefix to give a
fully qualified name.

Also make sure that submodules are added as an attribute to their immediate
parent package, not to some grandparent package with '.'s in the attribute
name.

bug 1085725

Change-Id: Ie571100898a33ed4fe15d1878c7b16db4caf4fa5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2012-12-05 10:16:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix importing of quantum resources subpackage

Apparently pkgutil.walk_packages(path) will return packages outside the
given path if they have the same names as the ones inside - so having a
quantum subpackage results in importing the global quantum package from
Quantum itself instead. Fix this by passing a package prefix to give a
fully qualified name.

Also make sure that submodules are added as an attribute to their immediate
parent package, not to some grandparent package with '.'s in the attribute
name.

bug 1085725

Change-Id: Ie571100898a33ed4fe15d1878c7b16db4caf4fa5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix importing of quantum resources subpackage

Apparently pkgutil.walk_packages(path) will return packages outside the
given path if they have the same names as the ones inside - so having a
quantum subpackage results in importing the global quantum package from
Quantum itself instead. Fix this by passing a package prefix to give a
fully qualified name.

Also make sure that submodules are added as an attribute to their immediate
parent package, not to some grandparent package with '.'s in the attribute
name.

bug 1085725

Change-Id: Ie571100898a33ed4fe15d1878c7b16db4caf4fa5
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-12-04 16:14:24.000000000', 'message': "Add sql db option to devstack for ceilometer

Ceilometer uses mongodb as the default storage.
This is one of the patches to support sql db option in devstack for
ceilometer, so users can easily choose and set up sql db environment
for ceilometer with 'stack.sh' by explicitly specifying the following
statement in localrc:

   use_database mysql

where mysql is taken as an example.

If users remove the above statement, mongodb is used and set up

commit_message:
Add sql db option to devstack for ceilometer

Ceilometer uses mongodb as the default storage.
This is one of the patches to support sql db option in devstack for
ceilometer, so users can easily choose and set up sql db environment
for ceilometer with 'stack.sh' by explicitly specifying the following
statement in localrc:

   use_database mysql

where mysql is taken as an example.

If users remove the above statement, mongodb is used and set up
by default.

This patch is for devstack to call dbsync to create ceilometer tables.

Change-Id: Idc9bffd0f389fa9760946b412c39210f60042d90
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-11-19 18:57:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So, after a cursory glance, the code seems pretty solid to me. The concern I have is whether or not this constitutes the ominous API contract change. If it does, then technically we shouldn't be trying to merge it, at least not without making the create with bdm but without image an extension instead. Technically, it doesn't *really* change existing functionality so much as make things more flexible. However, it does necessitate changing the API docs, so that's reason enough for me to put a -1.5 (since API changes are a Do Not Merge situation.) Rounding up, we'll call it a -1 for now.

At the very least, we would need to alert the doc team about this change. Please see https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13982.html"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Matt,

I added the DocImpact to the commit message with a brief explanation.

This patch is meant to put in the groundwork for a cleaner interface for booting from volume, and there will be (hopefully) more work done that will require new extensions and doc changes. 

The idea here was to make the patch as unobtrusive as possible, and still have the basic functionality in place so that further patches are easier to review and less likely to brake something.

Hope this answers your concerns.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:47:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Code looks good, and the API change shouldn't affect existing users"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-27 15:51:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the patch Nikola,

So I'm a little concerned that we've two separate approaches now to simplifying booting-from-volume.

One is where a snapshot is created from a running volume-backed instance (via the EC2 create_image API for example). This creates an placeholder image with no image data, but instead just acting as a bucket for properties (ramdisk & kernel ID, plus block device mapping props). The instance snapshot can then be booted in the normal way, specifying an image parameter but not a block device mapping parameter (as the latter is picked up from the placeholder image).

The other approach now is that a server can be booted with a block device mapping specified, but without an image ID.

I'm wondering if an alternative (potentially more consistent) approach would be for the novaclient to be extended to allow placeholder images to be created directly from a volume (i.e. snapshot the volume, then create a image containing the appropriate block device mapping property).

The server could then be booted using only the image ID, which seems more consistent with the normal booting idiom (and with the way EC2 enables boot from volume with volume-backed AMIs).

Just thinking aloud, but I'd be interested in your thoughts on the above line of reasoning ...

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-29 14:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

FYI the comment above is explored further on the ML:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002793.html'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-30 14:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The patch needs a rebase.

A couple of other thoughts ...

IIRC you mentioned on IRC that 'nova boot --meta ramdisk_id=X kernel_id=Y ...' could be be used to pass the required image metadata when the original image is not explicitly specified. However, IIUC this sets the server metadata as opposed to the image metadata and API._handle_kernel_and_ramdisk() doesn't look inside the server metadata to determine these properties (nor should it I think, as that would blur the lines between server and image metadata).

So do we need some alternative mechanism to pass in these metadata when the original image ID is not provided? (Or is there already another way of passing these properties?)

Also I wonder does nova have any reliable way of detecting upfront when such metadata are needed, i.e. when the image is not directly bootable but needs a kernel & ramdisk ID to be provided? If so, the attempted boot could fail-fast with an explanatory error.

Also just a point of information, that recently came to my attention ... if the bootable volume is created in the "new way" (e.g. with cinder creae --image-id), then cinder actually retains the original image metadata in its volume_glance_metadata table, keyed by the ID of the newly created volume (see  I8f98f6eaae005a33bfd49cea783774407b7aa120).

I don't think this is then exposed anywhere in the public cinder API, but if it were to be, it would provide a way of accessing the necessary image metadata (probably more an issue for a future nova boot --volume patch).

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-12-03 11:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-12-03 11:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Eoghan,

I rebased the patch.

I will respond to your comments above in a bit.

Cheers,
Nikola'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-03 12:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-12-03 17:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Eoghan,

As most of your concerns from the first comments have been discussed on the dev 
mailing list - I will respond only to the second message.

>IIRC you mentioned on IRC that 'nova boot --meta ramdisk_id=X kernel_id=Y ...' 
>could be be used to pass the required image metadata when the original image 
>is not explicitly specified. However, IIUC this sets the server metadata as 
>opposed to the image metadata and API._handle_kernel_and_ramdisk() doesn't 
>look inside the server metadata to determine these properties 
> (nor should it I think, as that would blur the lines between server and image metadata).
>
>So do we need some alternative mechanism to pass in these metadata when the 
>original image ID is not provided? (Or is there already another way of 
>passing these properties?)

This is correct, after looking at the code I realized I was mixing it up with the 
euca tool flags. I definitely see value in adding ramdisk and kernel_id as 
parameters when booting instances (to complement the --volume I hope to introduce)
through the openstack API. I would also like to suggest an alternative
approach, but more on this below.

>Also I wonder does nova have any reliable way of detecting upfront when such 
>metadata are needed, i.e. when the image is not directly bootable but needs 
>a kernel & ramdisk ID to be provided? If so, the attempted boot could 
>fail-fast with an explanatory error.

There is no easy way to detect this and it seems to me a bit out of the scope 
of this work (note that unless you provide proper values when adding an image to
glance currently - instances will not boot properly as well so this is not a 
new issue, nor is it confined to nova booting from volume). However - please see
below.

>Also just a point of information, that recently came to my attention ... if 
>the bootable volume is created in the "new way" 
>(e.g. with cinder creae --image-id), then cinder actually retains the original 
>image metadata in its volume_glance_metadata table, keyed by the ID of the newly 
>created volume (see I8f98f6eaae005a33bfd49cea783774407b7aa120).
>
>I don't think this is then exposed anywhere in the public cinder API, but if it 
>were to be, it would provide a way of accessing the necessary image metadata 
>(probably more an issue for a future nova boot --volume patch).

If we consider 'cinder create with --image_id' to be the preffered way of creating 
bootable volumes, then I see having metadata like kernel and ramdisk related to
a volume in cinder as a very natural way to go (and a god bit of work is already 
done in the patch that you reference). I like this approach also because it will 
make it more clear and explicit that volumes are first-class citizens when it comes
to booting machines.

I understand there may be some concerns around where this might go so 
I will put this in a blueprint and mention it on the dev mailing list so that there
is a common place to refer to in future patches, but in short, I see this effort 
around booting from volumes progressing  (at least in the short term) like this:

* Make Nova able to boot without image (this patch)
* Make Cinder relate image metadata when the volume is created with an --image_id
(introduced by the above mentoned patch)
* Make this data available through the Cinder API
* Make nova consider this data when booting from volume using bdms
* Add the --volume option to nova boot
* Add the --kernel and --ramdisk options to nova boot

It is worth noting that this is in line with the summary Vish made on the dev list
(http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/003505.html

With all this in mind, unless you object to any of the above I'm wondering if we 
can maybe proceed with this patch?

Cheers, N.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-12-03 18:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-03 18:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-03 18:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me
